text: Bottle (750ml) Dark reddish brown with thin tan head. Medium plus carbonation Dark fruit, very malty, maybe some chocholate. A Little wine.

330 ml bottle. Pours a dark copper with a yellowish beige, quickly disappearing head. The aroma is very lightly yeasty (dough), bready, beeswax,, some faint herbal hop notes and also settled notes of fermented pears. Full body with a low carbonation, a medium sweetness and a light bitterness. The alcohol is very well integrated. The taste is very malty, caramel, honey, brown sugar, meaty, hints of overripe fruits, but the sweetness is perfectly balanced by a nice hop presence (again with a somewhat generic herbal hop bitterness, bitters). Finishes with a light pleasant alcoholic warming. Overall complex and very smooth to drink - a really good beer.
Dark copper-ish body with a low head. Caramel, figs, yeast, spices. Well made.
Fassiger Brauner mit üppiger Cremekratzigkeit. . Hefig, alkohart & GAUL☺ 0,33l Sharing with Maui. Thanxxx!!!!

BBE 03/06/2018. Tuuhean ruskea väri, semiok viipyvä vaahto. Tuoksu täyteläisen huumaava, makea, suloinen... Suutuntuma alkoholisen lämmittävä, maukas, mieto, ruskea, hivenen raaan tuntuinen mutta silti pärisee kyllä.

Originally rated on 12/24/08. Aromas of dark fruit such as cherries, plum, fig, also yeast, caramel, and hints of bread. Appearance was a deep rootbeer brown body with loads of huge yeast flakes. The head started out large and slowly went down leaving decent lace behind. Flavors were similar to the aromas with the fruits and sweet yeasty breadiness all intermingling. Alcohol was well hidden for 9%. Overall a pretty good beer thats worth a try.
Drunk from 33cl bottle from the beer discovery project. Enjoyable dark ale.

Robe ambrée rousse claire, mousse blanc cassé bien calibrée, aérée et moyennement persistante. Bullage moyen. Nez très doux, sucré, presque pâtissier (frangipane) et vanillé, très gourmand. Bouche parfaitement équilibrée : gourmande et douce, mais en aucun cas excessive. Sucré tempéré, enrobé par des notes herbeuses et grillées. Subtile amertume qui ponctue la gorgée et nettoie le palais. Corps moyen à fort, ample, texture moyennement épaisse, mais aucune lourdeur. 9° bien masqué, très buvable. Carbonatation assez vive. Brune gourmande et complexe, mais terriblement buvable. Rondeur exceptionnelle.

Bottled @many places, somewhere in time from the early belgian years.
In short: robust belgian ale.
Pours hazy dark amber-copper with frothy light tan head. Long head retention, some lacing. Roasty, caramel, bready, dried fruits, raisins, yeasty nose. Medium body, average carbonation, some crispy texture. Taste is boozy, sweet, roasty, spicy, Remember it as a good one.
Aroma maltoso. Amaderada, licorica, cuerpo pronuciado, carbonatacion alta . Trago corto. Una buena triple brune belga, aunque durilla de beber

Bottle. Deep brown to red, medium tan head, very sparkling. Aroma of malts, grain, hazelnuts, touch of chocolate, light roasty, sugar cane, figues. Taste is light to moderate sweet, with just a touch of bittery on tongue, very fruity; heavy malty background. Medium to heavy body, lively carbonation, slick texture.

Color marrón tirando a rojo (rojo si le da la luz), con capa de espuma de un blanco amarronado de tres dedos de grosor (textura jabonosa y cremosa y buenísima retención). Carbonatación a tope literamente (en boca mucho más sutil, casi inexistente). Cremosa y untuosa. Aroma dulzón, a madera, chocolate, dark fruits, pasas, higos, ligerísimamente especiado, alcohol (estilo vino tinto). Sabor dulce de nuevo, con presencia de todo lo previamente citado (muchas dark fruits, pasas e higos), final ligeramente amargo y alcohol increíblemente disimulado (presente pero no tanto como uno se espera por el aroma, ni siquiera quema en los primeros tragos). Regusto y postgusto suave a dark fruits y pasas. Otra delicia proveniente de Bélgica. No me canso de este elevadísimo nivel.

0.33l bottle. Malty aroma. Hazy dark copper color, white head. Malty taste, dates and figs notes, light alcohol notes, light sweet, light bitter. Medium to full body, slick texture, soft carbonation and light sweet finish with light alcohol notes. Good.
DWF mørk brun offwhite skum. Aroma gjær frukt. Smak søt frukt rosiner malt karamell

Bottle from Beergium. Aroma is dark malt, caramel, toffee, raisins, spices, yeast, sweet dried dark fruits, touch of nuts. Flavour is sweet and lightly bitter. Body is above medium. Quite good, very smooth and balanced, complex aroma. Lots of caramel toffee, yeast, dark fruits. Surprisingly good, almost gives Abt 12 a run for its money, I dare say its more easily drinkable.

A bottle from lApero, drunk at home. Aroma: vegetables, but sweet, not unpleasant. Appearance: hazy, brown minimal lacing. Palate: full-bodied, creamy texture, soft carbonation. Long, well-balanced finish. Taste: sweet and malty, well-balanced, good beer.

Sample, but i bought some bottles. Will re-rate once tasted again. Redish brown with a big off white head. lively carbonation. Caramel, dark fruit, nuts?, yeast and a hint of roastyness in the aroma. Taste is mostly sweet but somehow not too sweet. Alcohol is well hidden. Very complex

Dark red. Spicy, fruity, and phenolic, with a strong yeasty character. Full, sweetish taste that finishes dry, lightly bitter and warm. Medium body, and prickly carbonation. Overall, a very good belgian strong ale. Strong, complex and very yeasty, but somehow not that harmonious. Something is a little off.

Pours hazy deep amber with a foamy off-white head. The aroma contains malt, hops, caramel, wood, wine and herbs. It tastes light sweet, light sour, medium bitter, with a dry, fruity, citrusy finish. Very well balanced. Full body and soft carbonation. Excelling in its style.

Barwa brunatna, piwo klarowne, piana średnio-intensywna, kremowa i długo utrzymująca się. 
Aromat słodki, mieszanka suszonych owoców (daktyle, figi, rodzynki) i nut melasy, karmelu. W tle nuty pieprzowe i alkohol.
W smaku wyraźnie owocowe - suszone owoce, banany, nuty cytrusowe. Cukier kandyzowany, karmel i nuty przyprawowe. Finisz wytrawny, alkoholowy, rozgrzewający.
Raisin and toffee and some earthy notes. Carbonation quite high, whiskey like colour and great head retention. This is a smooth beer.

Presa in bottiglia. Allolfatto si presenta piacevolmente invasiva, malto tostato, caffè e liquirizia. Schiuma fine ma non molto persistente. Al palato oltre al tostato si sente molto il caramello. Una birra non proprio beverina, soprattutto per il corpo e per la gradazione alcolica che in realtà è ben camuffato. In ogni caso una grande birra.

330ml bottle purchased online. 9% alc./vol. Pours an opaque brown colour with one finger of head that reduces to a 1/4" ring. Yeasty aroma with notes of toffee and chocolate. Taste matches the aroma with a malty backbone, raisins, prunes, and a bit of caramel that leads to a well balanced finish. I also detected some subtle spicy notes toward the end. Full bodied with moderate carbonation. Its comparable to Rochefort 8 but a touch sweeter. Excellent Belgian Strong Ale.

Bottle from Beergium. Copper color, white head. Bitter taste with citrus, malts, toffee, earthy notes, yeast, ripe fruits and a bit of oak. Bitter finish with citrus, malts, yeast, ripe fruits, oak and toffee. Excellent Belgian strong ale.
Medium brown with light, isotropic head. Sweet, brown malt, fruit. Lovely balanced flavour of herbs, balanced malt, anise. Medium body, smooth palate long herbal finish.

Bottle. Dark Reddish Brown. Fruity spicy aroma. Very malty, caramel, candy sugar, chocolate notes. Lots of fruit, dried fruit, raisins, plums, cherries. Spicy. Yeasty; lots of floaties and debris. Some balancing hop bitterness. Nice warming alcohol. Rich. Moderately sweet-bitter. Lovely! (2008)

Bottle 75. Robe rubis et mousse beige éphémère. Nez : caramel, fruits (prune, pêche, raisin surtout), alcool. Bouche : douce, veloutée, saveurs fruitées comme les arômes détectés et le côté alcoolisé "type porto" ! Rondeur, finesse, céréales et en fin, une discrète amertume. Bonne bière qui réchauffée fait penser à nos meilleures trappistes belges !

Bottle from my Secret Santa this year, V_Duquerroux, cheers Vincent for this want!Very much in dubbel territory this one but without the sickly candy sugar i dislike, full bodied, clear, moderate carbonation, quite sweet, fruity, boozy. Moderately bitter. Its okay but would put plenty of others above it on try before you die list!

0.33 bottle @ home   A nice thick head of good retention. Aroma of spices, berries, flowers. Taste is quite similar with pleasant flavors already present in the aroma, marzipan is introduced. Nicely creamy, delicately herbal. Good beer, not great.
Aroma of burnt hops and treacle. Pours a dark brown with a very small off white head. Taste of treacle with a dark chocolate finish. Exceptional beer.

From 330ml bottle. Pours dark reddish-brown with some carbonation, but head quickly disappears. Malty aroma. Taste is of toffee, malts, dried fruits. Quite a complex palate with changing tastes in the aftertaste. Not particularly bitter, quite smooth.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

33cl bottle, shared at home. Dark murky ruby-brown pour with a thin tan head. Notes of dried fruit, prunes, raisins, red grapes, caramel, sugar, dark cherries, port wine. A very well made Belgian strong ale.

Bottle from K&S in Bruges. Pours deep brown with a fawn coloured head. Nice fruity aroma. The taste has stewed fruits, fruit cake, toffee, spices and a slightly herbal finish. Maybe a ouch. Coriander and aniseed in there. Honey too. Full mouthfeel. Nice.

Aroma plum, raisins, toffee, wine barrells and candy sugar. Taste is plum, raisins, tart, butterscotch and honey comb. Candy suger sweetness thoughout. Smooth for ita abv. Appearance Is a hazy amber with plendy of small fruit sediment in suspension. Appearance is a thin beige head that retains fairly poorly.

Es una Strong Ale de color rubí oscuro que muestra en copa una bonita corona color marfil y su correspondiente encaje conforme va cayendo. Doble fermentación, la última de ellas en botella.

Aroma dulzón, a pesar de que al contrario que otras del estilo no contiene azúcar añadida. Mucho menos ningún tipo de aditivo químico. Es decir, malta de la mejor calidad (siete tipos diferentes), agua pura de subsuelo rocoso y lúpulo. Aparecen también matices afrutados en su aroma.

En boca tiene buen cuerpo, es como esa sensación cuando estás degustando un buen vino. Se perciben notas dulzonas (aunque menos de lo que su aroma presagia), caramelo y frutas maduras, ciruelas pasas. Se aprecia también madera quemada y un poco de café muy a lo lejos . Quizás incluso algo de chocolate puro.

Destacar también la gran cantidad de sedimento en la botella, procedente de la levadura. Como siempre os digo: un chute de vitamina B y minerales en toda regla.

Una birra madura y profunda. Para beber sin prisas y disfrutarla, porque además de todo lo que os he contado, su contenido alcohólico pasa prácticamente inadvertido.

Aroma - caramelized sugar, raisins, oak, cherry skins, marshmallow, and some vanilla
Appearance - the body is seal brown. There is some sediment. The head is 1/3" is beige, and settles into a small film.
Taste - has a mix of fig, caramelized sugar, some golden raisins, some oak, some barrel char, touch of marshmallow flavor, cherry skins, and vanilla.
Palate - medium body, sticky texture, average carbonation, slight alcohol astringency.

Backlog, Bomber Bottle. Pours a hazy brown with decent head and lacing. Nose is dark fruit, bread, yeast, caramel, candi sugar, fruit, and raisin toast. Flavor is most of same with sweet and dark fruit/malt and classical belgian strong notes. Medium bodied with a somewhat bitter finish for all the sweet fruit in it. Nice
Aroma of caramel, prunes, raisins, spices. Pours brown with beige head. Taste is medium sweet with dried fruits, caramel, brown sugar. Low bitter finish. Overall good.
Sample @ proeverij wijnhuis Blerick. Bruine kleur. Aroma en smaak van caramel en iets likeurigs, best wel zoet. Beetje dun mondgevoel. Nog eens een flesje kopen om te re-raten.

UPDATED: APR 29, 2017 Jolie robe cuivrée avec une mousse crème épaisse retombant assez vite et laissant une fine couche.La carbonatation est bonne.Le nez nous offre rapidement des arômes de porto,fruits noirs macérés,malts,houblons,caramel et épices: une grande richesse!La bouche nous amène sur des saveurs à limage du nez avec un petit côté "piquant" bien agréable.La finale nous laisse sur une douce amertume quon aimerait plus longue....Une bonne brune,chaleureuse mais un peu trop sucrée et levurée!

UPDATED: APR 29, 2017 Dégustée dans un verre Maredsous.
Température de début 9 à 10°.
Robe brune à reflets rouges, fine mousse beige assez persistante, bonne carbonatation.
Nez  sur les fruits noirs(pruneau), la réglisse et une  touche levurée.
Le goût apporte des saveurs fruitées,de vins cuits(Porto,Madère) et une douceur pas tout à fait équilibrée par une pointe damertume.
La finale est de longueur moyenne mais un peu sur la douceur dun sucre très présent et la chaleur de lalcool.
Un bière dabbaye pas niveau des grandes Trappistes.
14,5/20

La simplicité est la clé de toute véritable élégance » disait Coco Chanel. Cétait avant. Lors de son défilé, lAbbaye des Rocs présente sa miss Belge éponyme. A peine lescarpin posé sur le tapis que la nouvelle brune laura démentie. Chevelure fine et disciplinée, elle porte une robe de couleur brun foncée, tirant sur le rubis par leffet des jeux de lumières.

Le défilé est millimétré : 7 sortes de maltes et 3 types de houblons (belge, allemand et tchèque).

Ses matières premières, de grande qualité, permettent doser la corpulence dans lélégance.

A premières vues, notes chocolatées, caramélisées et de pruneaux. Sentiment de puissance et de force pour cette dame au parfum aromatique complexe.

Nullement potiche, la verve qui lanime est à son image : richesse et finesse se développe au fil de la discussion, plutôt dense. Ladage voulant que ces dames choisissent leur parfum à leur image a prouvé sa justesse : son léger caractère brûlé complète ses traits de personnalité de maltes sucrés et caramélisés. La douceur chocolatée ne fait quadoucir la puissance sans pour autant lui enlever sa force.

Dame onctueuse et riche, son côté pétillant lui permet de persister à briller sous la lumière.

Cette dame a donc démontrée quil est tout à fait possible dallier élégance, profondeur et puissance, en toute complexité.

Preuve que les brunes ne comptent pas pour des prunes, la brune pur malt simpose aujourdhui en haut du podium.

Special Guest : Mme Jybi

Piwo lekko metne w kolorze ciemnobrazowym z niezbyt obfita biala piana znikajaca bardzo szybko. W aromacie jest slodko, suszone owoce, ziola i karmel. W smaku owocowe bogactwo, toffee i lekka czekolada. Sa tez drozdze i lekki szlachetny alkohol. Goryczka na niskim poziomie, wysycenie na srednim. Ciekawa pozycja jesli chodzi o cene i dostepnosc.

330ml bottle. Poured a dark, slightly muddy brown with an initially tall though slowly fading beige to light tan head. Slightly tart dark fruits, yeast, nuts, earth, toffee and vinous aromas/flavours. Medium to full body, soft carbonation and a moderate length and intensity malt finish. Not the freshest bottle so flagged for a rerate should I source another.
Jaakon ja pojun kanssa Tuulensuussa. Hyvät belgioluet maistoissa. Ja hyvä paikka.
Bottle from Brdr. Schmidt Vinhandel, Viby. Pours dark brown with a tan head. Aroma and taste is malt, dark fruits, caramel, brown sugar. Medium body. Soft carbonation. Nice fruity finish.
Bottle. Dark brown, creamy foam. Aroma: malt, caramel, plums and prunes, a little wine. Taste: malt, port wine, plum, candied fruit, raisins, caramel, very good.

Brun och rejält kolsyrad. Torkad frukt och en len smak. God och lätt trots 9%.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draft at brewhouse gallery . Dark reddish brown moderate head. Vinous pruny brown bread aroma . Mega dark fruit yeast sweetness, somewhat port-like. Mild bitterness, slight sour snap, smooth mouthfeel. Very complex.

Hieman punertava, keskiruskea hieman samea olut. Vaahtoa aika vähän ja sekin vähä häviää hyvin nopeasti käytännössä kokonaan. Todella paljon isoja hiivapartikkeleita kaatuu pullosta jo puolessa välissä lasiin. Tuoksu hyvin maltainen, mämminen, rusinainen ja makea. Maku myös makean maltainen ja luumuinen. Loppupuolella makuun tulee pientä kuivuutta ja mausteisuutta. Täyteläinen, mutta hiilihappoisuus keventää tunnelmaa kivasti. Ei ihan pärjää parhaille Abbaye des Rocsin tekeleille. Edit. Tämä ensi kuussa "vanhaksi menevä" pullo on ulkonäöltään aiempaa kauniimpi. Vaahtoaa reilummin ja samettisemmin. Ulkonäkö 3->4 ja samalla kokonaispisteet 40->41
A little too much syropy taste in this bruin. Too sharply sweet somehow. Other than this Id say it is a solid Belgian Bruin fare.

Data ważności:  21.04.2018 
 Kolor:  Brązowy z czerwono-rubinowymi odcieniami. Nie jest do końca przejrzysty. 
 Piana:  Wąska, lekka, praktycznie niewidoczna. Przy tak wysokim wysyceniu znika z sykiem w oka mgnieniu. Milimetrowy krążek otacza górną warstwę Trappist Glass.
Śladowe ilości piany na ściankach. 
 Zapach:  Aromat jest na prawdę pierwszorzędny. Słodki, słodowy z wieloma warstwami zapachowymi. Pierwsze uderzenie było w klimacie czekolady, odrobiny kawy i kakao. Gdy tylko zniknęły te składowe pojawiły się kolejne w postaci orzechów włoskich, karmelu i toffi. Daleko na zapleczu lekka paloność. 
 Smak:  W smaku Brune jest kompletnie inne niż w aromacie. Odnajduje tutaj więcej czerwonych i ciemnych owoców. Jeżyny, ciemne winogrona, rodzynki i aronia.
W kolejnym łyku pojawia się toffi i karmel i delikatny brązowy cukier.
Co pewien czas piwo przypomina młode wino gronowe.
Przy następnym łyku na podniebieniu osiada trochę miodu.
Fajne musowanie na języku. Goryczka niewielka, słodowy finisz.
Faktura gęsta, ciało pełne.
Słodkie, gładkie, ale wcale nie mulące. Wibrujący, ciepły alkohol równomiernie rozchodzi się po całym ciele. 
Żywe wysycenie podbija pełnię.
Wysokoprocentowy trunek, ale o pokaźnej pijalności. 
 Wysycenie:  Wysokie. 
 Podsumowanie:  

Abbaye des Rocs uwarzone zostało jako czysto słodowe piwo. BEZ DODATKU cukru.
Użyto aż 7 rodzajów słodów i 3 rodzaje chmielu (belgijski, niemiecki i czeski).

Wzorowy przykład Belgian Strong Ale.
Perfekcyjnie wyważony, doskonale zbalansowany i bogaty zarówno smakowo, jak i zapachowo.
Najbardziej zaskoczył mnie aromat który miał akcenty czekolady i kawy. To nieczęsta sugestia w przypadku BSA. 
Aromat i smak łączył w sobie masę słodkich nut: toffi, karmel, kawa, słodkie owoce.
Należy jednak pamiętać, jak już wyżej pisałem, że nie ma tutaj grama cukru!
To jest fenomenem.
Piwo pełne, gęste, wyklejające usta i podniebienie.

Dodam na koniec, że za piwo zapłaciłem 7,8 zł.

8 ZŁOTYCH ZA 6-te Belgian Strong Ale na świecie???

Chyba nie muszę już więcej nic dodawać ;)
750 ml bottle pours brown with a tan head. Aroma of dark fruit, malts, caramel and coffee. Taste is caramel, fruit, wood and honey.

330ml bottle. Brown colour. Medium beige head. Dark fruits, hints of berry wine, caramel, hints of coffee in the aroma. Burnt caramel, dark fruits, hints of berries at first. Hints of coffee and caramel in the middle. Liqeury notes, hints of brown sugar in the end. Hints of coffee and spices in the aftertaste. Very well balanced, rather medium bodied belgium strong ale. Good one.

Karmijnrood bier met licht beige schuimkraag. Geur: fruitig, banaan, peer, wat alcoholisch. Smaak: zoetig, rozijn, wat banaan, basterdsuiker. Redelijk volmondig. Matige koolzuurprikkel. Afdronk: zoetig - bitterig, rozijn.

Bottle @ home. Pours with a dark brown reddish colour, big rocky tan head. Aroma is very Belgian: typical yeasty notes (basement aromas), and spices; some hops too. Taste is medium sweet, medium bitter, slightly sour, slightly salty. Medium body, oily texture, soft carbonation. A good, well-done triple.

Piana bardzo obfita i sycząca, szybko opada do chmurki, gushing przy otwieraniu. Barwa czerwono brązowa, brzydko zmętniona - sporo dużych "farfocli" wewnątrz trunku. W aromacie głównie suszone i kandyzowane owoce, jasne winogrono, porto, karmel i stary chmiel. Smak dość słodki, winogronowy (co ważne, nie dodawano tu cukru), ogólnie powtórka z aromatu, przy czym jest wyraźna rodzynka i suszona gruszka macerowane w brandy czy mocnym słodkim winie - fantastyczna sprawa. Goryczka niska, ziołowa. Wysycenie średnie, pełne, wyklejające w odczuciu, może nie gęste, ale treściwe. Alkohol? - bliższy 5% niż 9 :)
Gdyby nie ten stęchły chmiel w zapachu i gushing piwo byłoby genialne, a tak jest po prostu bardzo dobre. Podejrzewam, że inna butelka - lepiej przechowywana lub świeższa (moja ma datę do 10/02/2017) mogłaby zahaczać o ideał BDSA.

Aroma: raisins, plums, banana, alcohol, dark caramel, strawberry (pretty sure thats aromatic malt), doughy, some biscuit, molasses?. 
Appearance: dark red, very cloudy, off white head with good retention. Quite the gusher though, impossible to pour nicely in the beginning- all of the yeast got resuspended and is in little flakes inside the glass. I dont know what to say as this was really unexpected. 
Taste: same notes as in aroma but with more prominent alcohol warming, quite sweet, some more dark caramel, gentle roast, nonexistent bitterness, honey-strawberry taste that I adore from the aromatic malt. The rest is the same and quite interesting, complex.
medium body, creamy, slick feel, lively, long sweet finish with some lingering aromatic malt, dark fruits leftovers. Equisite.
Overall: A sipper with amazing complexity, I can see coming back to this beer for more, despite its significant alcohol warming and sweetness which are not really faults but move away from the typical belgian "drinkability and slight dryness" of dubbels/brunes. Apart from that the presentation is its only fault due to the significant gushing and resuspending of the yeast.

UPDATED: MAY 19, 2016 Känguruh pub Vienna, 0,33l bottle. Slightly alcoholic, sweet, caramel aroma. Brown color with a creamy head. Cake, chocolate, sweet taste, very complex one. Leaving bourbon, sweet, rich aftertaste. Lovely beer

750ml bottle. Floaties galore inside an unfiltered cherry brown body. Beige/off white head. Deep malt tones, a hint oxidized certainly. Fruity yeast notes, lots of red fruit. Very classical, rustic Belgian Brown. Good, but not as good as I remembered it from years past.

750 mL bottle shared by ebone1988. Vintage 2013. The pour is a ruby or copper with an absolute ton of light brown chunklets floating about. There is a nice thick ring of light khaki head and a little bit of bubbly lace as it falls down. The aroma it is a little tart. There is a nice maltiness to it. There is a good bit of brown sugar and a little spiciness that really comes through on the back end. Its nicely balanced, with a hint of tartness that I cant really place. The flavor is very bi-directional. Its sweet and carries a light dark fruit up front and it morphs through to a ton of breadiness. It finishes like a Belgian strong should, but there is just bready malts. I was hoping for a little more complexity in this one. The mouth feel is pretty decent. There is a nice thick creaminess to it, but it is a little over carbed. The aftertaste is bready and carries a little malty spice to it. This one could be great, but the chunklets just take too much away.

UPDATED: MAY 8, 2016 Bottle shared with koleminer20. 2013 vintage. Aroma is dark fruit, raisins, slight tartness, apples, spices, really nice. Appearance is red brown, light tan head, TONS of sediment in an otherwise clear beverage. Taste is bready, sweet malt, dark fruit, raisins, overwhelmed by the breadiness. Mouthfeel is medium body, light carbonation, lots of sediment and the standard bitter Belgian Strong aftertaste. Overall, I bet this beer would?ve been something fresher. Still, fine for the style.
Arômes de bourbon, vanille. Robe marron/rubis. Bonne mousse blanche. En bouche, un peu sucré, pas amère du tout, bien rond, vanille.

Bardzo miły słodki aromat, głównie rodzynki, karmel, kandydowane owoce, słodkie winogrona. Smak słodki, ale nie zamulajacy, mocno karmelowo rodzynkowy, suszona śliwka, wiśnia. Alkohol prawie nie wyczuwalny. Posmak słodki, ale z lekką goryczką, karmelowy. Ciało pełne, tekstura gładka, niskie wysycenie. Bardzo smaczne.

330 ml bottle, vintage 2013, bb 11/10/2015.
Dark copper-brown body, with a lot of floating yeast and a small, creamy, beige head.
Aroma of caramel, dried fruits, berries, cocoa, milk chocolate, some pices.
Tastes of dried fruits, cocoa, caramel, cinnamon, some toast, some wood, subtle alcohol.
Medium, creamy mouthfeel, with an average carbonation.
Finishes smooth, medium sweet, a bit dry, slightly roasty, with cocoa, wood, spices, fruits, some alcohol warmth.

Really tasty. Very smooth and perfectly balanced, complex, but also feels simple at the same time. Quite sweet, but not too much, with enough smooth, dry, slightly roasty notes. Alcohol is greatly hidden, just providing some warmth. Among my favourite Belgian dark strong ales Ive had so far.

Marrom escura, de pouca turbidez, espuma de baixa formação e pouca persistência. Aroma maltado, achocolatado, açúcar caramelizado. Paladar de dulçor intenso, pouco amargor da torrefação. Corpo licoroso e baixa carbonatação. Final de longa duração trás um pouco de tabaco, achocolatado, maltes torrados, álcool menor do que o esperado pela % o que é um bom sinal.

Bottle. Dark amber color, cloudy liquid with a lot of sedimentation (never seen so much in a beer before), yellowish head. Alcohol smell. Aroma of liquor, bananas, cinnamon, exotic spices. Heavy malty sweet, light sour. Warm alcoholic finish. I really enjoy this one a lot.

Bottle from Hops & Malt. Quite typical, yet not an extreme Belgian strong. Some candy, some booze, some fruits and resin. Full in taste and warming on the palate. Good balance, but rather low carbonation. A little more of that wouldnt have hurt. Still a very decent brew.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2017 butelka, warka do 29/05/2017. lekki gushing, wysoka ladna piana, metnawe, bursztynowo brazowe piwo. aromaty intensywne, karmelowe, toffi, suszone ciemne owoce (rodzynki, figi, sliwki, wisnie), troche swiezyc owocow (wisnie?), troche przypraw (cynamon?), ciut alko. w ustach nieco syropowe, mimo ze dosc wysoko wysycone, ewidentnie slodkie, powtorka z aromatow, ciut kwaskowate, goryczka odnotowywalna, przyprawowa alkohol dobrze ukryty, grzeje w gardlo. w posmakach pojawia sie melasa. calosciowo: klasa. bardzo ladnie zrownowazone. ale... chyba spodziewalem sie jeszcze ciut wiecej. Rami Rami is drinking an Abbaye des Rocs Brune by Brasserie de lAbbaye des Rocs at PowiśleGushing i latajace syfy, ale bardzo pycha. Figi kandyzowane kroluja. Rami Rami is drinking an Abbaye des Rocs Brune (2013) by Brasserie de lAbbaye des Rocs at Muzeum Azji i PacyfikuSuszone i kandyzowane, slodkie owoce, Figi, rodzynki itd... tez melasa. Mniej ciala niz swiezsze chyba, brak alko, na cieplo ciut moze :)Ocena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).
A peine versée que la levure se met à danser dans le verre. Un régal pour les papilles autant que pour les yeux! Goût splendide dû à une torréfaction poussée qui développe un caractère puissant.

W aromacie belgijskie suszone owoce i przyprawy, karmel, biszkopt, intensywnie, acz nie do końca przekonująco. W smaku półpełne, suszone owoce, biszkopt i karmel, goryczki brak, stosunkowo gładkie, pijalne. Wszystko na swoim miejscu, ale zachwyty nieuzasadnione.

33cl bottle - none is basement aromas, dark fruit and candi sugars. Flat. Best by march 2017. Grassy hop flavor. Quite sweet. Good but doesnt really stand out for the style. ABV is well hidden. Gets breadier if not roastier with every sip.

330ml bottle from Beers of Europe. Pours a medium misty brown with a quickly dissipating off white head. Malty aroma, with hints of fruit and wine. Complex taste of rich malts, some nicely balanced sweetness and bitterness.

Robe brune et trouble. Pas de mousse. Quelques particules en suspension.
Arômes biscuit, épices, levure, banane, vanille. Goût caramel et fruits confits qui restent longtemps en bouche. Légère aigreur sur la fin. Texture sirupeuse et carbonatation très fine.
Une bonne bière.
Bottle from Saveur. Pours dark, hazy brown with off white head. Aroma of figs, caramel. dark fruits and malt. Sweetish taste of figs, dates, caramel and brown sugar. Sweetish finish. Nicely balanced.

Pullo @ Saveur-Biere. Kaatuu tulpaaniin tumman punaruskeana ja kirkkaana, noin sormen paksuisella vaahdolla. Tuoksussa on vahvana luumua, marjaisuutta, tummaa hedelmäisyyttä, kellarimaisuutta ja makeutta sokerimaisessa muodossa. Maussa makea marjaisuus ja luumuisuus on vahvaa, sokeria ja puumaisuuttakin löytyy. Suutuntuma on täyteläinen, makea ja todella runsas. Makean marjainen ja monipuolinen vahva belgi, runsas ja täyteläinen tapaus.

Botella. Presencia marron oscura con corona beige persistente con carbonatacion media. Aromas a cerreal pan y levadura, sabor a pan con notas ligeras de cafa y mucho caramelo final dulce algo seco y ligeramente alcoholico, buena cerveza.

33cl bottle, served in tulip glass. Poured a dark amber brown with a one finger slight tan head that disappeared quickly. Wonderful aromas of wine, caramel, dark fruits, raisins, plums. Taste: Just amazing what is going on in my mouth right now. Raisins, vinous tannine, vanilla, whole wheat bread, plums, caramelised creme brulee, roasted malts, some sourness in the back, dates, tart, chocolate, hazelnuts, espresso, oak wood. This is unbelievably complex! A full body with a slightly tart and dry tannin finish. The 7 types of malts are clearly present. What an amazing brew this is...

Aroma: Dark fruits, malts, belgian yeasts. 
Appearance: Deep red to brown, tan 2-finger head. 
Taste: Medium sweet, light bitter, very complex, very well balanced. 
Palate: Full body, medium carbonation, long bittersweet finish. 
Overall: Perfectly balanced, delicious, one of my favourite belgian strong dark ales.

Een voor mij totaal onbekende Belg. De rating op RB een reden om hem mee te nemen. Uit de fles geschonken, mooi bruin bier met een hoop koolzuur. Aromas van mout, gist, gedroogd fruit, pruimen, caramel. Dit komt ook zeker in de smaak terug, waarbij de smaken mooi in balans zijn. Een verrassing!

Dark brown colored, small tan creamy head, some yeast sediment. Aroma is of brown sugar, caramel, dark fruits, some toasted malt, spice and Belgian yeast. Taste is medium+ sweet brown sugar and caramel, toast, dark fruits, spices, yeast, light spicy bitterness, light alcohol notes. Medium to full bodied, soft+ carbonation, creamy. 
(bottle, Bierhalle Deconinck, Vichte)
Bottle from Lambicus. Brown colour with tan head. Malt, caramel, roasted aroma. Sweet, malt, caramel, roasted, fruity taste. Medium to full body.

Caramel, roasty, yeast, brown and amazing red reflections a huge tan head quite persistant, medium sweetness with notes of coffe (burnt), fruits with a bitter final, full body, average carbonation...amazing as expected.

Bottle from Deconinck, Vichte - FR. Color: deep dark brown beer near to black no carbonation and medium ivory brown head. Smell: roasted malt, caramel, toffee and alcohol with soy sauce notes. Taste: full body with amazing complexity. Superb taste. Good palate. Caramel and toffee well balanced with incredible belgian yeast notes. Coffee and some chocolate finish notes. Aftertaste: roasted malt, caramel and toffee. Small coffee notes. Alcohol but really not present. Quiet drinkable for 9 ABV. Amazing, Im in love!
Bottle. Brown color with huge off-white head. Malt aroma, sweet malt flavour, caramel, plums
Bottle split two ways. Murky brownish pour with a frthy head. Notes of prunes, caramel, vanilla, plums, dries fruit, orange and cereal. Nice!
*Old rating. Best before 12/03/2013. Great deep complex stuff. Intense nuts, caramel, plums, chocolate. Moderate bitter, great deep in the aftertaste.
Bottle shared by Maakun after Borefts 2014. Sweet sugar, roasted, lemon, fruit, cocoa, spices. Interesting complex blend of fine flavors. Backlog from 2014/09/27.

Bottle erupted. A few other reviews mentioned it happening to them as well so be ready if yours does the same. Light brown with minimal head. Bubbily sweet raisin flavor first swig. Aroma vaguely like that of red wine. Malty and roasted nuts, though both are subtle. Same can be said about the red wine character. Extremely subtle beer, whats all the fuss about? I let it warm a bit and the flavor opens up some more. Finish longer and more enjoyable still not a very tasty one for me. Not bad in any regard, though hugely overrated.
Flasche, 0.33l. Braun, trübe, feinporiger fester Schaum. Duft nach Pflaume, Feige. Trockener Antrunk, Alkohol nicht spürbar, sehr süffig. Fein malzigee Körper, Dörrobst.

From elcervecero. In Teku glass. Watching Sons of Anarchy 1x10. Although the aroma could improve, the taste is pretty delicious. Alcohol completly hidden. Had some sediments that didnt affect its taste

Bottle L151107341 bff 29/05/2017. Extreme gusher. Red-brown color with direct vanishing extreme foam mass. Aroma of sweet malt, soy sauce and sugar candy. Taste is less sweet as the aroma suggests. Caramel, dark fruit and a little wine-like.

Little glass in delirium bar in Brussels! Spicy citric smell, with some apple maybe aroun there. Brune look with white head. Deep taste and balanced, have taste of caramel and marzipan. Great complex ending has well. Fantastic.

0.33 l bottle from belgiuminabox, bottled in March 2015. Clear, deep red with a huge, creamy, slowly diminishing, tan head. Sweetish, fruity-malty aroma of raisins, plum puree, dark cherries, caramel and port. Sweet, fruity-malty taste of raisins, prunes, candied cherries, caramel and port, followed by a yeasty, slightly bitter and warming finish with notes of dark chocolate. Medium to full body, creamy and smooth mouthfeel, average carbonation. Very tasty and complex, superbly balanced and moreish. Great!

Bottle. Brown color with light head. Aroma has caramel, yeast, malt, nuts. Taste is malty with long a bit bitter quite sweet finish. Flavors of malt, nuts, caramel, fruits.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone
Bottle. Dark brown colour. Caramel, ttoffee aroma. Sweet, caramel taste, plums and raisins

Bottle exploded when opened.
Aroma is close to the one of the La Montagnarde from the same brewery. Alcohol is still present, but maybe in a softly way.
Not my type (I probably said that to all the beers of the same genre), but this could be a nice beer for people enjoy this kind.
Light coffe colour. Medium roasting. Light licorice taste. Feels a bit dusty in the mouth.
Mousse éphémère. Goût de malt très présent. Alcool fort présent. Pas damertume. Bière agréable à boire.

One of my favorite go to Belgian ales
The entire line up is aggressive yet drinkable. My only regret is I never had stored any to age when I first tried it 15 years ago.  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android

33 cl bottle @ home. Murky red-brown beer with a medium, white head, non-adhesive, bit of flocculation on the bottom. Aroma is chocolate, caramel, figs, nuts, Medium carbonation. Taste is caramel, nuts, fruity, chocolate. Aftertaste is alcohol, nutty, some bitterness, but turns to sour/sweet at the last moment. Wow!

Degustata in bottiglie da 75 centilitri. color caffelatte cioccolato fondente 60%, schiuma persistente pannosa, aroma e retrogusto di liquirizia e liquoroso e leggero sentore di castagna ed odore di miele di tiglio. Si beve molto velocemente nonostante i 9 gradi in etichetta. Birra come poche. Avercene di birre così... ottima per inaugurare lautunno.

0,33l from bottle at känguruh pub vienna. BB 03/2017. Smells malty sweet, plums, raisins, light wood, marzipan. Served quite cold. Full body, soft carbonation, quite full mouthfeel. Big taste of plums, sweetness, raisins, spices, light wood, alcohol. Finishes with plums and spices. Decent enough, a bit heavy and sweet / almost simple. Overall good 

8, 4, 7, 3, 14

Nen déplaise à dautres commentaires : le nez est insipide ! Donc on passe.
En revanche, beaucoup à dire en bouche ! Déjà, la laisser reposer au moins 5min, laisser la mousse tomber pour quelle saere : lalcool déséquilibre tout. Une fois calmée, équilibre parfait entre le caramel (brune oblige), la levure et...un troisième goût furtif, instable qui me laisse penser à une datte confite...
Cette bière reste extrêmement intéressante et étonnante !

Bottle 33cl. Deep dark brown, small frothy beige head, mostly diminishing, light lacing; complex nose, dark malt, dried fruits (prune, date, raisin), caramel, brown sugar, ahorn syrup, cocoa, cinnamon, cloves; taste medium heavy sweet and slightly bitter, dark fruit, caramel, woody notes, alcohol; full bodied, creamy texture, soft carbonation, sweet taste continues in the aftertaste, spicy notes, some licorice, light bitter touch in the finish; really great beer.

Rossa scura con riflessi color rubino, schiuma beige di media persistenza.
Aroma di nocciola e anice, tostato, caramello, uva passa e leggero fico secco.
Al palato sempre nocciola, uva passa e amarena, leggero cioccolato e caramello.
Anche se prevale il dolce è equilibrata da una piacevole coda amaricante erbacea.
Corpo medio-pieno, ben carbonata, oleosa.

dark brown colour with ruby notes, 1 inch creamy beige head, which lasts for severl minutes; aroma of dried fruits (figs and raisin), caramel, some minimal herbal notes, biscuit and spicy alcohol; taste of dried fruits, candy sugar, biscuity notes, hints of mild roasted coffee and minimal sourness; spicy alcoholic aftertaste with some bitterness; excellent Belgian strong ale for reasonable price - one of the best value for money, Ive ever experienced

Bottle to celebrate my 3rd anniversary on RateBeer. Pours hazy copper brown with airy but stable beige head. Clear aroma of malt and caramel, with fruity and leafy notes and touches of hops. Sweetish notes, of malt, raisins, caramel and fruit, with hoppy and estery notes and some faint dusty touches. Dusty and estery aftertaste with fruity hints. Rich body. Well-balanced and very enjoyable. Great stuff.

Robe brune avec des reflets rouges, mousse beige assez haute qui disparait lentement en laissant une dentellle sur le verre. Nez automnal de fruits secs, de fruits rouges et de caramel. Bouche dune grande complexité sur les fruits secs, le preneau, la fraise, la framboise, le caramel, des notes dexcellents spiritueux. Le corps est rond complexe, excellente carbo. La longueur est interminable. Bière extraordinaire qui mérite sans doute dêtre vieillie.

7/28/2007 4:10:54 PM Bottle at home. And what a bottle - lot 2009. Have been looking forward to this one. Smells quite skunky, rich, sugary. Very large foamy head. Quite strong flavour. Malty, textured. Lots of tastes into the finish. Enjoyable.
With quite a nutty aroma, this beer pours perfectly with a big frofy head and a dark brown complexion. This brown beer has a complex flavour that lingers and keeps you coming back for more.
Pours dark brown with creamy white head. Aroma of malts and cherries. Taste is sweet, malts, caramel, dark fruits, molasses, spices. Creamy, smooth... masterpiece!

Robe de grosse belge, noire reflets rouges et mousse blanc cassé.

Nez dépices, cannelle, vanille.

En bouche, très fruité, acidulé, fruits rouges, liqueur, cerises (et fraises).

Les neufs degrés sont discrets.

Bon !

Pours brown with large light brown frothy head. Aroma is malty, sugar, raisin, date, toffee, cinnamon, milk chocolate and rasberry. Flavour is sweet, port-like - bitter, hint of smoke in the finish. Body is medium to full, palate is oily, carbonation is lively.

Bottle. Pours in hazy dark body with medium tan head. Aroma is nutty, milk caramel, light dark candi sugar. Taste has mediu nutty sweetness, evident alcohol. Low earthy bitterness. Body is full, high carbonation.
Muddy brown color with a little foam. Brownish licorice smell. Decent carbonation with a smooth sweet licorice note. Malty sweet aftertaste.

Bottle from Saveur Bière. Small frothy, white head. Brown, hazy body. Smells of plum, apricot, yeast, barley. Rich taste of wheat, caramel, almond, plum, very sweet and bitter. Soft aftertaste that dissipates quickly.

UPDATED: FEB 20, 2016 Donkerbruin bier met een schuimkraag die na vijf seconden compleet is verdwenen. En met die schuimkraag lijkt ook de smaak wat af te nemen. De eerst slok is heel erg lekker, daarna iets minder uitgesproken. Maar toch nog zeker een heel goed bier.

Hazy, dark red brown with thick light beige head. Aroma has spicy yeast, fruit, caramel, perhaps some chocolate and light alcohol whiffs. Quite complex. Flavour has sweet caramel and dried fruit, prunes and figs. Warming alcohol and nice bittersweet finish. Smooth and creamy mouthfeel. Good. Really good...
0.75 l bottle. Dark, cloudy appearance. Bitter sweet taste. Rather sweet aftertaste.

F: very thin quickly gone to nothing.
C: dark hazy opaque brown.
A: very nice sweet rich malt and fruity.
T: caramel malt, banana, bready, cherry, plums, raisins, a hint of coffee and chocolate, anise like, brown sugar together with some bitterness, very nice and impress Belgian strong ale, from Carrefour express in Brussels, try it!

UPDATED: JUN 22, 2015 fles gekocht via firmabier.nl, uitgeschonken in Gouden Carolus bokaal. Troebel mysterieus, roodbruin mahonie kleurig bier, met bruisende beige schuimkraag, die snel vertrokken is, een dunne schuimlaag blijft tot de laatste slok in het glas aanwezig. Volle zoete aroma's van gedroogd fruit, rozijnen, vijgen, dadels, toffee, karamel, Belgische gist, en subtiele tonen van rode wijn. Het smaakpallet is fraai complex en gebalanceerd tussen, zoet, kruidig en zacht bitter. Met tonen van boterachtige toffee, karamel, gedroogd fruit, met name rozijnen, en dadels, chocolade, rode wijn en bruine kandijsuiker, met als afsluiting een gebrande, houtachtige zurige toets. Deze Abbaye des Rocs Brune, heeft weer die specifieke Belgische smaak, die je ook vind in bieren van Westvleteren, Rochefort, St. Bernardus en Achelse kluis. Staat op RB in de categorie vermeld als Belgian Strong Ale, maar heeft veel kenmerken van een abt. quadrupel. Het mondgevoel is zoet met een lichte carbonatie en een afdronk van een subtiele en verfijnde hoptoets, de alcohol van 9% is goed verborgen. Een prachtig gebrouwen bier, kan zich met gemak meten met de beste Belgische bieren in deze stijl.

Pours a rich ruby brown colour, heavy sediment (as in chunks of yeast being poured however this is most likely due to my poor pouring technique!) and small tan head. Aroma is figs and dried fruits, slight spice, sweet malt, and doughy yeast. Taste is malty sweet and nicely balanced bitter, complex and enjoyable. Smooth feeling in the mouth and the alcohol is well masked. Very good indeed!

Bottle. The looks is probably the weakest element - cloudy reddish brown with unstable beige head. From there it goes only uphill. Complex aroma, banana, bread, chocolate cookies, hints of anise, mint. Taste in line; sweet and spicy, long malty finish containing all of the above. Great beer. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Marrón oscura con abundante espuma beige. Aroma de frutas del bosque y especias. Sabor complejo, con malta, uvas, hierbas y cítricos. Abundante carbonatacion y buen cuerpo. Cremosa y rica.

330cc bottle. Pours reddish brown. Really sweet. Great complexity of flavors and aromas: earth, spice, yeast, malt, bread, caramel, fruiits, nuts. Some bitterness. Highly drinkable for. 9abv 100% grain. Oustanding.

Hazy brown colour, big white head. Aroma of dried fruits, bread, caramel, yeast, hops. Dry sweet taste, lightly bitter finish and a bit spicy aftertaste. Medium body and average carbonation. Nice fruity Belgian ale.
Bottle at home, 30th May 15. Pours dark brown, lots of bubbles and a little head. Aroma is sweet, bready, yeasty, caramel. Taste is complex, sweet, malt, yeast, banana, caramel. Lovely beer
Dark hazy amber color with lot of flakes floating around and nice big head. Aroma is dark fruits and yeast. Flavor is malt, dark fruits, bread, chocolate, sweet.

Very sweet, but very well balanced also.
Outstanding aroma.
Rich and complex, a lot of good things in to this beer!

Huge maltiness, caramel, candi sugar, dried fruits, dark fruits, some hops, light nuts, some spices not too pushy. Mostly sweet with light bitterness and light tartness. Complex and well balanced brew.
a really nice malt beer,some dried fruits, some caramel nicely balanced with a warming aftertaste
UPDATED: SEP 2, 2015 Arima is pretry straight forwad to goog lvl, taste is the same but u can feel the quality and consistancy of taste.

33cl flesje via Firma Bier
Alcoholpercentage van 9%
Uitgeschonken in La Trappe glas

Uiterlijk: donkerbruin/rood met mooie dekkende schuimkraag

Aroma en smaak: caramel, bitterzoet, rozijnen, donker fruit

Conclusie: erg mooi bier inderdaad, maakt de hoge verwachting gezien de rating waar. In het rijtje van Rochefort.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Od wszelakich strong ale stroniłem raczej, ale trzeba wypić dobrego przedstawiciela, żeby styl docenić. I Abbaye des Rocs takim przedstawicielem jest. I nawet wysoko zawiesza poprzeczkę! Kolor ciemnobrązowy, ze sporą, puszystą pianą o czerwonawym zabarwieniu. W aromacie rodzynki, czekolada, ciemne owoce. Piękna kompozycja! W smaku świetnie wyczuwalne rodzynki, delikatny karmel i sporo owocowych nut. Trochę przypraw... Przyjemne, gładkie piwo. Bliskie doskonałości!

Colore marrone rossastro, schiuma fine e cremosa. Carbonazione scarsa.
Odore frutta matura, fichi, dolciastro. Sapore dolce, fruttato. Alcool abbastanza ben nascosto. Buon equilibrio di sapori, anche se il dolce è il sapore prevalente. Molto corposa, quasi masticabile.

Pours ruby red with medium head disappearing fast. Aroma: plums, raisins, wood, dried dark fruit and caramel. Taste: rich taste of dark dried fruit such as plums and raisins is followed by some heavy malt and woody taste, finishing with a warming palate. Nice one.
Bottle from Appellation Wines. Pours dark brown. Nose is very malty, brown sugar, wood. Taste is malty, brown sugar, toffee, caramel.

AROMA : caramel, bread, cereal, toast, roasty, plum, raisin (grilled, then in the aftertaste fresh), cooked apples, bubblegum, banana, butterscotch, woody, spicy, complex. 
APPEARANCE red, brown body, bit hazy, frothy, white foam with outstanding tenue. TASTE : heavy cloying sweetness, lightly bitter, bit salty. PALATE :full body, creamy, average carbonation, long sweet finish with fuzziness. OVERALL a great strong ale like no others, leaves nice long aftertaste no so overwhelming as the taste/aroma itself. Bottle from fridge, champaign glass.

Bottle at home in London - sourced in a trade. Pours clear chestnut brown with a lot of sediment with a creamy beige head that calms down faster than I expected it would. Great aroma, lots of semi-dark fruits, raisins, caramel, rich bread, some Belgian yeast, candi sugar. Big sweet flavor with scoops of caramel and toffee, lots of ripe fruits, berries, some toasted grains and bread, very mild earthy bitterness. Medium to full bodied with fine to average carbonation. Only mild warmth in the finish, some further toffee character, dark bready malts, some esters, fruitcake, bread, toasted sugar, caramel. Delicious stuff. Quintessential.

NOTA DE CATA:
- Aspecto: De color marrón oscuro con reflejos anaranjados a contraluz. 
- Aroma: Su aroma es dulce, afrutado y con matices tostados que no logran ocultar totalmente el olor alcohólico que desprende. 
- Cuerpo/sabor: Al paladar encontramos una cerveza afrutada, dulzona, con tintes azucarados y predominancia de ciruelas maduras.

UPDATED: MAY 15, 2015 My sample had many yeast floaties. Not sure this is typical. Colour is dark amber. Average head. Aroma are all about dry fruits. Sweet but sufficiently dry. Very well balanced. Reminds me of st bernardus abt.

Das Bier ist dunkelbraun, leicht rötlich, trüb und bildet wenig aber beständigen Schaum.
Es ist sehr aromatisch: Rosinen, Röstmalz, Schokolade, etwas Süße, Gewürze. Hier gibt es eine Menge zu entdecken.

Sehr gutes Bier!
UPDATED: MAY 31, 2016 Very dark brown colour with big reddish head. Aroma of dark chocolate malts, caramel, raisins, dark fruits, hops. The same is the taste. Overall good, complex beer.

Bottle from Dranken Verheyen in Poppel. The beer is dark ruby red colored and pours a large cream colored head, with average carbonation. The aroma is rich palate of sweet and bitter tones, like raisins, caramel and dark fruits but also hops and spices. The taste is smooth and full and is medium sweet and fruity, which ends in a well balanced bitterness with some spices and the 3 hops are just a little noticable. The finish is long, complex and is pleasantly bitter.

Bottle 0.75L.
Hazy dark copper body with large, frothy, tan head, mostly lasting with some nice lacing.
Moderate-to-heavy malty (caramel) and light hoppy (citrus, flowers) aroma with notes of red fruits, spices, alcohol; very light feeling of medicine.
Moderate sweet flavour with light acidic note.
Medium body with watery-to-oily texture; soft carbonation; light alcoholic warming in the finish.

Bottle. Darkest red, cola pour. Modest but lasting head with little lacing. Sweetness in the aroma is noticeable from across the table. It is lovely blend, robust, characteristic. Yet, it is difficult to pinpoint the fragrances. Dark chocolate, prune, light hairspray booziness, rye, faint hint of ripened soft cheese, hint of chickpeas, fresh grass notes. Near perfect amalgam. Taste starts sweet and salty, mostly salmiakki. First sip really hits the palate hard. Saltiness abates quickly, and in subsequent tastes the sweetness comes through: chocolate, bubblegum, faint hint of red wine, hint of coffee/espresso. Again: near perfect mix, very nicely balanced, robust. Aftertaste is slightly sticky, dry. Very nice.
Bottle, 33 cl, Belgobaren, Stockholm. Overall exciting aroma and taste, interesting.

Pours a warm ruby with a beautiful creamy light tan head with great retention.

Rich aroma of yeast, raisins, caramel and a hint of cherries.

Full body, creamy feel, average carbonation. Taste is also sweet and malty with dark fruits, licorice and spices. Long lasting and warming finish. Excellent!

Hazy ruby/mahogany, thin creamy offwhite head. Sweet and malty, red berries, vinous notes. Medium body, soft and round, soft carbonation, medium sweet, medium long finish. This is a lively one, raisins and dark fruits come as this gets warmer and gets more air. Quite delicate flavors and nuances, sophisticeted feel, good balance, easy to drink.

Light brown frothy head. Fairly persistent. Copper, red shadows, cloudy. Intense and fairly persistent at nose. Dark honey, chocolate, coffe, caramel, a hint of alcool, raisin. Thick body, average carbonation.

Superbe robe brune. Nez puissant sur le malt, légère note torréfiée, épices, banane, fruits mûrs, levure. Bouche à lattaque ample, une superbe rondeur, une rétro épicée et caramelisée, longue finale riche et équilibrée. Une très grand brune, pas loin de la Rochefort...
Flaska från Saveur-biere. Mörkt brunröd med mycket beige skum. Doft av karamell, choklad , jäst och lite körsbär. Söt med lite syrlig eftersmak, inslag av karamell och choklad.

Bottle from Beergium.
Hazy dark red/brown with a white foam ring.
Sweet, yeasty aroma with a lot of figs and raisins. 
Taste is very sweet with chocolate, caramel, slight citrus and faint bitterness.
Medium to full body, soft carbonation, smooth.
Very easy to drink, quite dangerous due to the high abv. A bit too sweet for me and the aroma was quite faint. Still quite good.
An amber Belgian strong ale with caramel and coffee, a little bit sparkling and bitter with a spicy end. Lekkere bier
Bottle. Dark ruby with little head. Taste and aroma share toast, caramel, toffee and a little dark fruit. Medium-thick, somewhat sticky with a long finish. Simple and almost perfect.
Bottle. Brown with a small head. Not a lot of life and slightly sweet. Didnt really realise its strength which should be taken as a compliment. An excellent beer.
Pours a murky chestnut with an off white head. Lovely dark fruits aroma and a taste of this with spices.

Hazy amber color with big white head. Aroma of spicy yeasts, coriander, toffee, and a hint of tartness. The tartness reminds me of cherries and berries. Taste is more toffee, caramel, malty, dark fruits with prunes, raisins, nice booze kick. Carbonation is smooth but prominent, very creamy texture. Warming finish with spices. A complex classic indeed. Still feels fresh despite the heaviness. Superbly priced as well. I like it.

Eccellente belga. Si presenta di un marrone con riflessi rosso scuro e un ampio cappello di schiuma beige di buona persistenza e compattezza. Al naso principalmente malto e caramello. Sin dal primo sorso il dolce del malto è predominante e perfettamente equilibrato, ricco e intenso, unito alla buona presenza dellalcool che le da un corpo pieno. Senza dubbio una di quelle strong ale che ricordi, sulla falsa riga di una Chimay, St. Bernardus e simili.
Bottle bought at Geers. Pours amber, brown, almost no head. Aroma of prunes, raisins, malts and caramel. Flavour is malty, spices, little roast, coffee. Lovely dubbel.

Bottle from Appellation Wines. 
Appearance - dark brown to black with a reddish tinge. Nice head. 
Nose - stewed apples into prunes with backdrop of toffee and candy sugar.
Taste - stewed prunes with a slight boozy backbone. Finishing with drying toffee. 
Palate - medium to full bodied with a creamy yet tangy texture and a finish that is somehow sweet and sour at the same time. 
Overall - very indulgent.

Classic massieve ale, tasted young but also at 20 years of age - which is possible in this case, since it has been in existence since at least 1984. Deep, cloudy bronze beer under a tight, yellowish white head. Very malty and spicy, deliciously so, with aniseed, coriander and cloves adorning the basic but complex, caramelly and nutty maltiness; very well-balanced with herbal hops and warming, liqueurish alcohol in the finish. I have loved this ale ever since I first encountered it, I guess Ill have to buy a new bottle for a re-rating; the 20-year old sample at the Kulminator proved that this is a firm and stable beer managing to bridge many years of ageing. Justly a classic, in every sense of the word.

330ml bottle from Appellation Wines. Pours clear brown, thick beige head. Aromas of plums, almonds, raisins, prunes. Taste is more dark stone fruit, light almond booziness. Rich texture, long sweet, spicy finish. Lovely.

UPDATED: MAR 31, 2015 Botella 33 cl. color marron rojizo muy oscuro espuma beige claro de buena formacion. Olores q recuerdan algo vino tinto, a frutas rojas, a malta tostada, a levadura, algo de azucar moreno, platano...muy complejo. En Boca el sabor es menos potente q el aroma, pero redondo. El dulce es medio/ alto el amargor tirando a bajo, un toque ácido.  Los sabores muy similare a los del aroma con final a fruta madura y levadura. La carbonaticon es media la textura media. Un birrote!

birra bruin, di color ambrato scuro, al naso salgono sentori di prugne. Al palato gran carico di luppolo e caramello con un finale di cioccolato. Birra molto equilibrata tra dolce e amaro che la rende morbida. Spettacolo.

Appearance is mahogany brown, a small fizzy beige head which doesnt last long. Lumps of sediment come out with the pour. Aroma- caramel, yeast, banana, dried plums, brown sugar, stewed apple, bread, malts, toffee. Taste- lovely. Fluffy mouthfeel, but some carbonation to see things along. Dark fruits dominate- raisin, plum, prune, hint of cherry, banana bread, toffee sweetness, thick and sweet finish. Excellent.

Dal bel colore marrone con riflessi ramati e dalla schiuma fine, cremosa e abbondante, che si stabilizza poi in una lamina sottile. Laroma è pungente e piccante: si sente il malto tostato, un pizzico di polvere di caffè, ma soprattutto un lievito pepato e un luppolo secco e deciso. Ottimo, davvero. Il corpo è quasi tagliente, si fa subito riconoscere, dando un taglio netto e deciso a tutte le possibili interpretazioni. 9° e non sentirli, quasi, tanto è pronunciato e corretto lequilibrio generale: un inizio frizzante e luppolato (i lati della lingua ne vengono subito pizzicati), con un progressivo allargarsi del malto tostato, della liquirizia (tenue) e del caramello, con un ritorno finale delle sensazioni amarognole del luppolo. Finale nel contempo morbido e amaricante, con il palato suggestionato dal malto e i lati della lingua dal luppolo.
Mooie donker rode kleur met een volle kraag. Ruikt zoetig, honing, herfstfruit. Smaakt zoetig, caramel, suiker.
Botella .de @Señor Lúpulo. Despacho de cervezas ...................... Casa 18/01/2014

Bottle. Hazy light brown/orange body, medium head. Sweet and delicately fruity (or some kind of perfumey) aroma without the excessive yeast/caramel combo that comes first in many other dark Belgians. I even get some fresh green apple peel. Sweet malty taste with more delicate fruitiness. High carbonation, but somehow the yeastiness is still floral and pleasant. Excellent beer, reminds me of Rochefort 8, only its even more smoother. This is an essential classic beer for sure.

Clear ruby copper, cappuccino head. Clean aroma with yellow mature fruits, dessert wine (passito), spices, caramel toffee and butterscotch. Smooth and full taste, which explodes in your mouth. Perfectly balanced.
Dark brown appearance, medium head. Aroma of dried fruits, caramel, roasted barley, coffee and chocolate. Some tannin, low bitterness, rich palate, sweet and balanced. Excellent Bruine style beer.

Bottle from Wine of Galilee in Tallinn. Deep dark brown colour with a hue of chestnut or mahogany. Head is massive initially but drops fast to leave a good layer and some thick lacing. Nose leads to believe that this is going to be quite sweet - its got a lot of caramel and toffee, but also a deep woody spiciness (kind of like caraway / cummin seeds and cinnamon), also a red berry tartness. Cant believe theres no added sugar here... A bit of an alcoholic note as its warmer. Taste is very sweet malts - again, so hard to believe its actually sugar-free! - that are somewhat taken over by moderate bitterness and fruity and bread crust sourness, then they mix to create a very nice chocolaty, cinnamony and bready finish with a tingle of warming alcohol. Body medium, carbonation thin but active, palate very soft and creamy, while the finish is somewhat malty dry. A fine, complex beer!

This strong ale showed a dense pour of a cloudy and intense reddish body letting loose tons of very fine bubbles with a vivid and thick hazel head sitting on top of it all. It showed a fair amount of retention and lacing but I would have expected more to be honest. The nose is very nice offering complex notes of floral hops, soapy yeasts, butterscotch, maple syrup and even some grainy malts. Not bad for a brew with no added sugar to develop such a sweet aroma. The taste gives away roasted and sweet malts almost imitating moka. There is a good balance between sweet and bitter that lets you enjoy even the taste. The warmth of the alcohol is perceptible and closely followed by a hoppy finale that wraps it all up in a very distinctive tasting experience adding a appreciable aftertaste. The mouthfeel is dense, oily but also sharp and vapory proving once again the complexity of the product. Overall this is a very well crafted beer that I strongly recommend not only for its quality but also for its complexity that will charm the connoisseur as well as the rookie since its very delicate and accessible.

Flasche (75 cl, MHD: 08/2015) von Belgiuminabox.com, ein Jahr im Keller gelagert. - Tiefes Kupferrot, viele unappetitliche Schwebteilchen; reichlich kurzlebiger Schaum. - In der Nase obergärig-fruchtige Süße, überreife Banane, ein Hauch von Fenchel oder Anis und viel Alkohol. - Antrunk breit dunkelmalzig mit zuckriger Karamelsüße, Noten von Süßwein und schweren reifen Früchten (Pflaumen, Feigen, Rosinen). Gut rezent, schaumig. Im Abgang nur schwache Hopfenbittere aber reichlich wärmend-weiniger Alkohol. Schwacher Nachtrunk. - Abgesehen von der unappetlichen Erscheinung (man sollte das Glas besser nicht gegen das Licht halten) überzeugt mich dieses Brune auch geschmacklich keineswegs. Zu süß, zu wenig komplex, zu schnapsig, ohne ausreichende Hopfengrundierung.
Currently I am updating my ratebeer with al the beers I drank but was too lazy to rate at the time. I give the scores I gave back than. If I drink the beers again I might re-rate them.
Dark with a fruit and roasted malt aroma. Brown sugar, cherries and a hint of chocolate. Very good
Bottle from saveur bier. Hazy muddy brown color, tanned head. Aroma is balanced, plums, raisins. Balanced taste, raisins, sweet notes, malts. Nice but basic belgian.
UPDATED: DEC 21, 2014 Nice and deep brown colour. Has an aroma of dried fruits. Amazingly smooth texture.
Bottle, 330 ml at Gollem Bier- en Eetcafé, Antwerp. Pours dark amber to brown with large beige head. Sweet, malty caramel, yeast, dark fruit. Bit spicy. Complex.

Thanks to tderoeck for the bottle! 

Pours with a big thick head. Lovey brown/caramel color - semi-translucent but basically opaque. 

A lot of sweet malts, caramel, and sweetness on the nose. 

The palate is very light bodied with a soft sweetness. Finish is long and sweet. I would recommend water biscuits in between if youd like to keep your palate fresh for this one. 

I recommend drinking it at the temperature on the bottle (12-14 C). I kept it in the fridge overnight and was greeted with a much more alcoholic profile showcasing its 9% ABV.

October 20, 2014. Bottle at home, best before february 2016. Pours dark brown with a dense quickly dissipating tan head. Aroma is sweet prunes, raisins, caramel, light spices. Taste is medium sweet with dried fruits, brown sugar, dark fruits, very light bitterness. Finish is light roasted bitterness and medium sweet toffee and plum. Medium bodied, quite fizzy carbonation.

21/11/2014 @home, 33 cl bottle from de Hopduvel.
Nice dark brown colour with light beige head. Aroma reminds me of forrest, fruits, nuts, malts, caramel. Taste is some sweetness, light bitternes, dark fruits, nuts, light mocha and bitterness at the end. All verry subtle and thats what makes this beer so strong, its subtility and balance. This is one of the only beers that has never dissapointed me. If I ever can have one with a long lasting head, it gets 5.

RateBeer Top 50 Belgium challenge. Nice dark brown with medium tan head. A bit of dark sediment in the last few drops. Rich, hot, dark fruit at the end. Overall very nice but this leans towards too hot/viscous for me.

Deep brown, small tan head. Aromas of yeast, red fruit, and considerable malt. Flavor is quite malt forward, very smooth, low carbonation almost like a nitro beer. Plenty of fruity esters. A bit overly sweet for me.

Mahogany brown colour with delicate head on top. Aroma has red berries, syrup and yeast. Taste starts with berries, tannin, slight syrup. Then there comes vanilla and cream. Pretty soft flavours. Medium body with medium carbonation.
cloudy, light sweetness, a very light taste of apple and malt, very nice beer
Wonderfully dark and full. Roasted and nutty and warm, although the alcohol is well managed. A great, unadulterated malty brown ale brewed to its highest peak.

Nose is caramel, bread tanin, sugars, spice, raisin, plum. Taste is brown sugar, nut, wood, spice, lifted by fruit notes, plum but also a touch of apple and pear, slight cola leading to a soft sweet nutty finish. Mouthfeel is good.

A delicious brune.

Bottle at Rose Red Cafe, Brugge, 17/10/14.
Hazed chestnut brown with a decent off white covering.
Nose is caramel, spice, dark malt base, toffee, earthy notes.
Taste comprises some bitter roasted notes, spice, toffee, dark fruit rinds, dates, prunes.
Medium + bodied, fine carbonation, lightly warming alcohol in the close.
Solid Belgian strong, good balance, but not quite seeing where the 4+ average score comes from!
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Riquísima tostada. Fuerte que entra como si fuese agua. Ideal para beber sin enterarte. (7/10). (Malte - A Coruña).

Couleur brune trouble, légère mousse beige, beaucoup de dépôts. Nez malté , candy, alcool, note fruits noirs. Gout malté caramel, fruits noirs,raisin, figue, épices, poivre, notes réglisse
 et zeste orange. Fin avec petite amertume

Cloudy tea-brown with lots of big flakes of sediment floating around. Half inch of consistent, fine tan head that fades moderate-to-slowly and leaves a film on the surface and substantial attractive ring around the outside. Aroma is white raisin, apple, figs, cherry, bit of grape, light bread and crust. Body is medium-light, on the watery side, very smooth moderate carbonation, fine creamy texture on the palate, no burn. Flavor is bread crust, hint of cinnamon stick and nutmeg, dried cherry, light brown sugar, moderate dates. Just enough heat on the exhale to keep things interesting. Fruitiness is understated in the flavor, in a good way. Hops are minimal (maybe hay or dried grass) and the very little bitterness is infused in the bread-crust flavor. I had pretty high expectations, but theyve been surpassed. Great beer! Reminds me of Rochefort 8.

UPDATED: JAN 1, 2015 330ml bottle served in a Chimay chalice. A: Pours a very dark amber to brown color forming a big soapy creamy beige head with great retention and some lingering and molasses lacings left in the glass. Quite dirty beer with lots of brown chunks floating around. That?s most probably the dirtiest beer I?ve ever had! 
S: Very sweet nose. Strong notes of caramel and crystal malts. Sweet brown bread. Very fruity too with strong notes of grapes and raisins. Candi sugar and Belgium bready yeasts. Toffee and caramel. Spicy hints of black pepper and vanilla. 
T: Complex taste too. Strong notes of dry dark fruits, mainly raisins, dates and plums. Candi sugar, caramel and crystal malts. 
M: Heavy and creamy body. A bit molasses. Medium to low carbonation. Sweet fruity and bready aftertaste.
O: Great drinkability. Sweet beer. Strong Belgian character. 
[ BA Review @ 1/28/2010 ]

Bottle @ home. Pours red/brown with a thin brown head. Aroma is caramel malt, toffee, raisins and dark fruits. Flavour is sweet and yeasty. Full body, creamy texture, soft carbonation, Finish is sweet and caramel.

"a sweet, woody, slightly spicy ull bodied belgian ale. better flavored and cleaner than either the tripel or grand cru. maybe still a touch overrated, but quite good. fig, malt, dark fruit, spice, candi sugar? lots going on here, quite smooth...still not quite a favorite."

750 ml bottle. Amber red colors big rocky beige head. Sweet caramel malt nose has notes of port and dark dried fruits. First sip yields a soft rich brown sugar maltiness that leans toward plums. Mid taste is sticky and sweet and complex with hints of vanilla and wood. Finishes with a spicy herbal hoppiness. This is a nice rich Belgian brown ale that is full of depth and complex character.
Botella de 33 cl, adquirida en Cerveceria Internacional. Color ambar oscuro. Sabor a malta, caramelo, uvas pasas, ligeramente a alcohol.

Bottle. Reddish dark brown with medium off white head. Sweet malts and candy sugar, roasted vegetables with syrup, lemon soda and dried red fruits. Hint of cocoa and spices. Sweet, medium to full bodied and very nice carbo. Classic

330ml bottle. Clear deep brown color. Medium size, creamy beige head, stays. Looks really nice. Prunes, caramel, sweet, bit woody yeasty aroma. Malty, touch of roast, sweet, nutty notes in taste. No signs of alcohol in taste. Sweet nutty body. Soft carbonation. Smooth to drink. Nutty, malty aftertaste. Nice one!

Bottle at home. Over 2 years old. Has a very deep reddish brown colour with a frothy, big, beige head. Aroma has lots of dried fruit, leather, oak, meat, heahter and some chocolate and alcohol. The flavour is similar a very rich with some licorice and more roasted malt, oak and chocolate. Has a slick and silky mouth feel, and a light bitterness. A rich, complex and wonderful dark Belgian strong ale.

Bottle, via trade with dresden (thanks Steve!). Deep golden brown with a lively beige head that retains beautifully. Sweet aroma of burnt sugars, plums, raisins, caramelized banana, vague spices. The palate reflects the nose perfectly, with a rummy quality and silky mouthfeel. Full bodied without being syrupy or cloying. Warming finish. Sublime.
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text: Deep red/amber in colour with a fine lightly tan foamy head. On the nose complexity of sweet malt, barnyard, resin and spices develop. The texture is somewhat slick offering a full body. Rather sweet with some snappyness to it. Well balanced with a lingering sweet-spiced finish.
Bottle 0.33l from Dranken Geers Ghent Belgium.Pour it dark colour with medium white head.Taste of dried fruits, caramel and very roasted malt.Perfect balanced sour and sweet.
UPDATED: SEP 16, 2014 In bottle (Delerium/Brussels); very nice beer ... poured a nice medium brown. Taste and aroma almost of root beer??? Somewhat sweet and bubbly ... very nice; I will buy again

Brown beer, tamn head. Nose is dried plums, yeast, malts, slight spice. Flavor is bready notes, lots of malt, dried fruit, sweet notes, hops, spice, caramel, hoppy notes in the finish, some chocolate and alcohol. Soft malty sweetness and tender bitterness balance out very nicely among all the other different flavors here. Lovely stuff.

0,33L bottle, BB 27.05.2015. Pours very hazy dark brown-red with light tan head. The head stays for some time. Aroma is sweet, intense malt, spices. Flavor is sweet & bitter, malt, dark fruits, spices. Finish is somewhat dry malty and fruity with hints of alcohol. Overall: very nice malty brew.
Out of the bottle at Cambrinus. Pours a deep copper and clear. Lots of complex chocolate throughout the aroma and flavor. Rich layers of bread dough.

Bottle. It pours a dark amber-brown with a firm and creamy beige head. Lovely aroma of plums, alcohol, smooth malts, yeast, caramel. The flavour follows through with a nice balanced malt character, brown sugar, fruity, yeast. Smooth, really very good.

Botella de 33 cl de el c. Ingles, tomada en junio de 2002. fecha cons pref para antes fin 2003. Cuerpo medio de 9 vol con una buena sensación alcohólica. Sabores intensos de maltas ligeramente tostados y dulces. Bastante buena y para repetir.

0.75l bottle. Dark ruby body, thin off-white head. The aroma is really sweet. It has nores of caramel, toffee, reisins, figs and ripe bananas. Taste of caramel, figs, candi sugar and banana with a touch of sourness and spicy hops. Medium bodied beer with slightly warming alcohol. Awesome beer.

Pours dark red to deep brown, smell is very strong an fruity. Little head, although agressive when opened. Taste is very full, some sweet notes, little varbonation, excellentely balanced. An extroadanary beer!

Bottle. Hazy deep amber color with a thin foamy brown head. Aroma of port wine, dried fruits and malt. Well balanced sweet and sour taste with some bitterness in finish. Medium body.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

Pours a small frothy off-white head that mostly diminishes. Body is hazy red brown.
Aroma contains moderate malts (caramel, straw, cookie, dark bread, roasted ad burnt malts), light hops (spruce, orange, grapefruit), light yeasts (leather, earth, barnyard) and sweet dried fruits like grape, raisin, etc., ear, ruby port, cola and spices.
Flavor is light acidic, then light acidic and light sweet followed by light acidic, light sweet and light bitter which then goes to sweet and light bitter and finishes in light bitter.
Body is medium with creamy texture and soft carbonation.
brilliant! Balanced, full of flavors and aromas and complexity.

33cl botle from ABCBeers.
Thin off white head. Clear blazck pour. Nice beer but not 100 rated IMO
Bottle, pours a nice brown with a thin beige head, aroma of malt, yeast, and fruits, taste is sweet with yeast, malt, caramel and dark fruits, finish is dry, very good Belgian Strong

Pours a hazy brown body with a medium head. Nice malty aroma of toffee. Round creamy taste of malty tones of all sorts of candy.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Simply amazing beer - notes of treacle toffee (I would love to know how they get this flavour without using sugars)
Topper! Een lekker bier beetje zoete afdronk. Je proeft niet dat het 9% alcohol bevat. Drinkt makkelijk weg.

Cloudy brown color, big brownish, creamy, staying head. Full body, soft carbonation. Aroma of malts, yeast, overripe fruits, raisins. Very smooth and creamy mouthfeel. Medium sweet taste. Very interesting.

2004. From bottle. Cloudy brown with a tan head. Aroma of clove, sugar, plums and berries / grapes. Creamy mouthfeel, vinous and sweet, frothy texture. Bananas, clove, bread, etc. 8/5/8/4/16, 4.1


2014, bottle from the brewery in Montignies-sur-Roc. 
Overpowering anise and fennel seed aroma.
Hot alcohol combined with this anise note reminds of schnapps.
Pasty and yeasty in the mouth, full-bodied, absurdly sweet and just a tad sour.
6/3/6/3/11, 2.9
330ml bottle from Vanuxeem. Pours dark brown with white head. Aroma of dark fruits and caramel. Taste is moderately sweet with smooth chocolate and caramel dominating. Hugely drinkable and delicious.
Absoluut mijn smaak niet, misschien dat dit sommige mensen gaat aanspreken, maar voor mij was het een tegenvaller

Bottle @ St. Nicolas, Brussels. Pours brown with a white head. Aroma of malt, yeast, caramel, dark fruits, plums. Flavor is malty, yeast, caramel, brown sugar, fruits, riasins, figs. Medium body, lively carbonation. 310714

Pours hazy caramel brown with a lw white head. Aromas of caramel, ripe apple, spices, honey, figs, raisins. Taste is caramel, honey, rye bread, roasted nuts, ripe apple, figs, raisins. Mouthfeel is smooth with medium carbonation.

Pours hazy brown with low white head. Aroma of caramel, toffee, raisins, figs, spices, yeast, honey. Taste is spicy and peppery, sweet, figs and dates, sugar finish. Lightly pleasantly boozy. Body is rich and creamy with average carbonation.
Bottle. Clear amber pour with a big white head. Mild caramel malt aromas. Mild caramel malt notes. Effervescent. Bubbly with some Belgian yeast notes.  Average body and mouthfeel.

Pours deep brown-amber with a medium tan head. Nose is yeasty and fruity. First lip is sweet and develops aromas of toasted malts, caramel, fruits and brown sugar. Oily texture, high carbonation. Long fruity and sweet finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Az élesztőtől kissé zavaros főzet erős édességet sejtet, mely be is igazolódik, azonban kellőképpen lekerekített ahhoz, hogy az édes íz bizonyos változatait is felfedezhessük benne. Igen intenzíven hajaz a diós sütemények ízére - mintha zserbót iszogatnánk -, valamint a kávé zamata is megjelenik benne, mégpedig az elkészített és édesszájú fogyasztója által ízesített kávéé. Összességében talán egy kicsit túl tömör, de mindenképpen érdekes és különleges darab.

UPDATED: NOV 5, 2014 Sicuramente unottima birra, ma mi sarei aspettato di più da una dalla sua reputazione! Lho trovata troppo gasata e un po spenta, almeno confrontandola con le mie aspettative. Ma sicuramente abbastanza gustosa e ricca di sapori. Da provare.

Bona cervesa, equilibrada i gustosa.
Buena cerveza, equilibrada y sabrosa.
Brown color with red hue with thick foam. Strong aromas of fruits, malt, caramel. Full body, malty taste with burned notes, herbal bitterness.
Pours a murky deep ruby,white head. Aroma is caramel,malts. Taste is sweet malts,sweet caramel,some booze,

Dark brown color. Sweet and intense smell, mix of caramel and chocolate, with some toffee notes.

Taste is very similar to the smell, but less intense.

UPDATED: JAN 31, 2015 Medium white head, black with some brown coloured body, sweet malts fruity candy some belgium estery yeast medium to high carbonation low medium bitter, malts sweet fruity some peach

Aroma: caramel, grain malts. Appearance: dark amber, small beige head. Taste: medium sweet. Palate: sweets expand, great caramel and honey flavours. Overall: fantastic Belgian String Ale. Bottle at Cambrinus, Bruges.

Bottle
Aroma-caramel, fruits, resin, 
Appearance-brown, cloudy, tan foam, 
Taste-light sweetness, medium bitterness, lightly sour, 
Palate-full body, thick feel, lively, long finish, 
Overall-perfect
caramel, roasty, raisin, soy sauce, black, tan foam, heavy cloying sweetness, medium bitterness, lightly sour, full body, slick feel, lively
UPDATED: DEC 12, 2014 Una bruna buonissima con una bella schiuma persistente. Great bruin beer. Trovata in un beershop di Milano.

UPDATED: MAR 5, 2017 Bottle, 75cL. @Naintre with my dad. A brown mahogany opaque beer ; beige big foamy head ; good retention. Fruity aroma (plum, dried fruits), roast, biscuit, herb. Medium sugary and warming sweetness with medium refreshing waves of bitterness. Full body, oily texture, average carbonation, medium sweet warming finish. Overall, delicious !

Dark brown, with dense, medium, white head, which lasts for not so long, low lacing. Complex malty sweetness, low caramel and bready moderately low dark fruit esters - plums, raisins, really interesting spiciness with some pepper and mint aromas, which makes it quite refreshing, very low hop aroma, moderate intense perfumy and spicy alcohol notes. Moderatly rich maltiness, sweet, low caramel and bread falvors, low dark fruit esters, again very interesting spiciness - peppermint, low bitterness, alcohol balance rich and malty character, its more like vinous-alcohol, semi-sweet finish. Thin, medium bodied, moderate carbonation, moderate alcohol warmth.
Rich, complex and strong beer with powerfull maltiness, balanced with alcohol and spiceness.
UPDATED: APR 15, 2014 Brown with a small head. Aroma: Sweet, light. Taste: Very well balance, sweet, caramel. Very good.

Cloudy, dark reddish amber color with a very fine, quickly disappearing beige head. Sweet caramel and fruity aroma (plums, raisins, dates). Sweet complex taste, lots of malts, thick consistency, very little hops. Nice long winey finish. Excellent.
Roodbruin licht troubel bier met veel schuim. Smaak licht zoet met zure afdronk, lichte nootachtige rooksmaak, die lang blijft hangen.

Bue en bouteille de 75cl. Une superbe bière ! Belle couleur brune foncé aux reflets rubis. Arômes boisés, café, caramel et graines grillées. Parfaitement équilibrée, du corps et de la douceur en bouche. Génial !

UPDATED: DEC 18, 2014 Brune tres sombre, petit collet persistant.
Aromes complexes tres fruité, quelques notes de café, de vinaigre de vin de bois.
Extraordinaire en bouche, dune rondeur parfaite, des notes de reglisse viennent sajouter a toutes celles citées ci dessus. Du velours !!!
Bonne longueur.

Brunlig uklar farve med gærrester. Let tyndt og flygtigt skum. Næsen er jern og lidt humle. Masser af kulsyre. Starter syrlig, men slutter med masser af julesødme og krydderier. Nærmest som en nisseøl ... lidt for sød. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
