Decent beige head, brown, black color. Light on aromas, bready malts and hints of toffee, wood. 

Warm, toasted malts at the beginning, which turn more present and sweeter at the same time. Carbonation is lively, vanishes soon, due to the intense malts. Interesting development on the palate, as the beer starts earthy, bready with hints of wood and rather dry, the malt needs a second to turn sweet and warming, with hints of fruit and also spices. Almost too sweet aftertaste, sticky. Refreshing at first, loosing its carbonation to the sweetness. Complex beer with a decent body, defined by malts, with an unusual high carbonation.

UPDATED: APR 9, 2014 Shared a 75cl bottle from Cora (Luxembourg). Pours a reddish deep brown colour with a very thin tan head. Aroma is malty, roasted, nuts and red fruits. Average to soft carbonation and medium oily body. Taste is well balanced, more sweet than bitter, with a long roasted caramel dry finish. Overall, a very pleasant beer that asks to be drunk

Cor marrom com tons ameixa, turva, espuma bege de média formação e baixa/média persistência com bolhas que ficam subindo para a superfície; pouco lacing que se desfaz rapidamente;
Aroma complexo de frutas vermelhas (ameixa mais proeminente e cassis)
Sabor inicial de frutas vermelhas com final picante e levemente adstringente; retrogosto com leve picardia.
Alta fermentação, boa dronkability. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Ins Glas ergießt sich ein minimal trübes dunkel rötlichbraunes Bier mit schöner Schaumkrone. Geruch sehr malzig süß, alkoholisch, belgische Hefe. Geschmack sehr malzig alkoholisch, fruchtig, würzig
Bu en bouteille de 33cl, une couleur brune et un col mousseux brun, en bouche on a un première attaque très forte sur la café et elle reste grâce au sucre en seconde bouche très bon

Short dark beige head with some candy, fennel and hops aromas. Quite complex. Opaque dark copper body. Thick in mouth like soup with chocolate, nuts and candy taste. Very rich and well balanced. Would be perfect with even more length and less "fat".

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

75 cl. bottle, shared - a slow gusher. Lovely unclear, dark amber colour with ruby hues. Dense, off-white head, that faded fast. Rich, fruity aroma with caramel malts, spices, yeasts, initial dark, dried fruits that turns in to something sweeter - apricot and raisins. Candid sugar and grass/hay notes, some alcohol. Taste is sweet. Full body, thicker texture and a lively carbonation. Finishes malty and fruity with some bitterness and a light hint of liquorice. Big, rich, very Belgian, complex and excellent.
Une brune typique belge, épicée, caramel, café. Je ny ai pas trouvé de complexité. Déception.

Bottle 0,33ltr: Hazy dark brown coloured brew with nicely bitter taste. Hints of caramel, spices, vanilla and some slightly sourness. This beer is very above expectations, thought first another Abbey Dubbel but i was wrong.

33 cl bottle, 9%, best before 20.2.2014, into a wide tulip. Appearance: Red color, clear with a lot of rocky sediment, nice smooth creamy beige head. Strong malty spicy nose.
Aroma is syrupy, lots of malts, dark bread, wood, earthy yeast. Dark grapes, red apple peel, a whole of raisins, nuts, caramel, plum, an hint of licorice, cinnamon, spices.
Winous indeed, very rich.
Taste has a wonderful harmony within malts sweetness and hops bitterness, a bit salty, umami, tasty, tasty and damn tasty, cant stop sipping. Finish is sweetish, but somewhat short with hoppy overtones. Medium to full bodied, a bit tart.
Palate:, alc 9% but the alcohol is subtle and very pleasing, liquor like, comes out after a while. Incredibly smooth mouthfeel, soft carbonation, creamy.
Overall: this is a wonderful, classy, ultra smooth. But personaly id like a bit more prominent hops profile, anyway for winter this is a winner.

UPDATED: AUG 31, 2014 Dark brown colour, slim creamy head. Nose and taste get a delicate mix of flavours with coffee, spices (pepper, nutmeg, clove), dried and sweet fruits like plums and figs, vanilla, gingerbread, liquorice, red wine and woody smokyness. Very balanced between sour, bitter and spicy with a touch of sweetness rounding it off. Lingering aftertaste. No big alcohol punch despite the 9°. Medium bodied, low-medium carbonation. Soft and dry mouthfeel, even a bit tard. Favourite brown ale out there: complex with big flavours but rounded and a smooth drink.

UPDATED: JUL 4, 2014 33cl bottle in a Trappist glass. Pours a wonderful dark brown colour with a moderate beige head. Truly amazing beverage. Rich cakelike taste with prunes, figs and lots of malt tastes dominate. One of the better (if not the best) Belgian brown ale I have tasted. Well worth the hype.
Bottle. Brown with a beige head. Aroma and taste is dried fruit, caramel, yeast, plums. Medium body, sweet warming finish.
Pours a murky red brown. Delicious aromas of malt and sweetess. Very soft, medium body with little carbo. Tastes of malts, maple syrup, red fruit. Complex, but very well balanced. Suberb beer.

Small bottle. Pours brown, beige head. Nose is toffee/molasses, alcohol, prune. Flavour is same with some leather. I liked this one but it was a little on the sweet caramel side to become a "classic" Belgian for me, sad to see Im missing out.
Medium chocolate-brown, pretty cloudy, with average-sized beige head. Nice smell of old chocolate and grapes, powerful taste, both roasted and yeasty. Behind that is a sweet, round note.

750 ml bottle. Poured a dark brown color. Aroma is spice, some boozy caramel notes, malts. Flavor is some dark dried fruits, touch of chocolate. Bitter, sweet malts. Alcohol is certainly noticeable. Pretty good on a cold winter night.

Shared bottle at tBierhuyske. Clear brown body with a beige heaad. Caramel, raisins and spices on the nose. Mouth adds dried fruits, honey and malty notes, a well balanced bitterness all wrapped up in a full bodied, smooth and alco warm delight.

@Weilands Market / Columbus Clear dark ruby brown with a long-lasting 1/2" tan head, small swirls of lace. Taste cant be tied down on the first swallow. This is a brew that grows better as it warms, and as it establishes itself in the palate. Begins with sweet fruit malt, adding dark fruit and earth in the palate, then moving very sm -o -o - o -thly through the palate to a solid, lightly bittered finish. On the first blush, it seems pretty conventional, but with each successive swallow, it becomes more and more absorbing, until it is one of the smoothest Belgian Ales Ive had. Deceptively effective; glad I have a 4-pack. Highly recommended.

75cl bottle @ home, bb 22/03/2014. Pours brown/ mahogany with a thick lasting brown head. Aroma is sweet, candy sugar-like, dark fruits, bready notes, spices, like clove comes to mind. Flavor then has dark fruits, sweetness, spicyness, malt. Finish is long, sweet and malty, spicy. Warming, but alcohol completely hidden. Full bodied, great balance. This one grows on you. So drinkable, so good!
Bottle. Pours reddish-brown with a medium off-white head. Aroma of nuts and caramel with dried fruits and a hint of chocolate. Nutty caramel flavor with a touch of cherries and chocolate. Dry finish.

Aroma: Almonds, dried red fruits, caramel, peach, hint of roast,chestnut, very nice complex nose Appearance: Brown, red glow, hazy, off white head, medium lace Taste: Caramel, chestnut, dried fruit, little sour, slight hint of coffee

Aromas excelentes. Ligeramente dulces y abundantemente frutales, destacando la manzana, uva, ciruela, cereza y pasas.

Referente a su apariencia color café obscuro con tonalidades granates a contra luz. Cuerpo medio, espuma media de baja retencion la cual sin embargo se adhiere a las paredes de la copa en firma de encaje de Bruselas.

En boca excelente. Suave, brutalmente frutal y con un excelente equilibriio.

Al paladar genial. En primera instancia suave, posteriormente frutal, en donde se percibwn notas a manzana, ciruela, cereza y uvas. Al final el equilivrio es muy bueno, dejando una ligera sensación entre acida y amarga. 

En general una grandiosa cerveza, diferente pero buenisima, en la cual en ningún momento se percibe su potencia alcohólica y en la cual y si su explosión frutal.
Godsdamn I used to drink the shit out of this amazing conception of Brune back in the Bottleworks days. One of the best.

A 33 cl bottle, pours a dark ruby with a beige head, aroma of chocolate and cherries. Taset is a little sweet and can taste a hint of cherry. Incredibly smooth with a well balanced palate considering the high alcohol content of 9%. Delicious and will be looking for more.
Bottle. Pours dark brown color, light beige head. Aroma of cherries, red wine, chocolate. Taste is sweet, chocolate, cherries, coffee, dark berries, higher carbonation. Sweet finish.
dark brown, light grey head. nose: chocolate, sulpher (?) and cleaning product. Taste: caramel, chocolate but also something off. did not like this one.

750 ml bottle Best Before 29/04/2012 poured into a brandy snifter. I wonder how old this beer really is. I cant seem to find anything using the googles. Oh well. The aroma on this one has walnuts, wet wood, toasted nuts, some sherry notes. Fairly complex aroma. The taste is fairly nutty and woody. Not really bitter in any way, but id is fairly dry, like a walnut hull. Some raisin comes through a little bit and really just tops this beer off. Very well done beer. I wish I knew how their bottle dating worked. I would guess this beer is at least 2.5 to 3 years old, but could easily be even older. I guess that just means I should load up on this beer for the cellar.

Aroma on this one was pretty faint. What I could detect was pleasing, but it didnt exactly jump out if the glass. Great dark ruby colour with a beige, soda pop-like wispy head. Great Belgian beer flavour. Earthiness, licorice and some smokiness are present with underlying sweetness and dark fruits. The palate could be better as there is quite a large amount of sediment, despite my pouring efforts, that is detectable while drinking. With a stronger aroma and less sediment in the glass this would be a truly beautiful beer.

Very good strong brown belgian beer!
very tasty and strong as I like :)
Next time with pleasure :)
From a 33 cl bottle shared at Ryans. Pours a hazy brown with a quickly dissipating off white head. Aroma of caramel and red fruits. Flavors of plum and candidate sugar. Smooth mouthfeel. Delicious.
caramel, nuts, toast, chocolate, alcohol, black, medium sweetness, medium bitterness, medium sourness, medium body, creamy, average carbonation,

Bottled, 0.33l. Pours murky brown with large frothy light brown head and nice lacing. Aroma of spicy malt, caramel, yeast, dried fruits and sherry. Taste starts with rich and moderate sweet malt, followed sour grainy and spicy yeasty, fruity with strong alcohol note, mouth-coating, while finished medium bitter with long aftertaste. Full body, thick texture and lively natural carbonation in palate. Hell of a strong beer, a bit too much for me...

33cl bottle into tulip.

Overall: A good brown ale. Good flavor, a little on the thin side for my taste. Enjoyable but not super memorable. 

Appearance: Deep ruby brown with thick tan head. 

Aroma: Roasted malt, toffee, chocolate, alcohol.

Taste: Medium sweet, slightly bitter

Palate: Body on the thin side, smooth texture, good long finish

Room temp bottle BB 2015, poured into a tulip. Sparkling ruby red with a big head like a cloud. Head continually expands. Looks good. Smell is yeasty - not a lot going on. Mouthfeel is medium to big and slightly foamy - feels rich. Taste is caramel malts, sweet fruits - cherry and banana, finishes with raisin. I didnt pick up the burnt wood until I read it in the description, and now I can notice it in the aftertaste. Very good beer, but I feel like I should have chilled it a bit.

Bottle. Hazy deep brown liquid with small light brown head. Aroma of toffee, dried fruit, raw sugar, raisins, caramel and light sweet alcohol. Taste is light to medium sweet and light bitter with notes of raw sugar, light bubblegum and bread. Medium bodied with medium to high carbonation. Really nice and balanced.
Luiquid caramel... Nice in every way. Just loved the smell and taste. Its like candy..
Great beer pours a reddish brown. Big head. Dark fruits and sweet malts are forward. Medium to full bodied. Great beer.

Poured into snifter to be dark amber red with a high carbonated cream head.
The smell of dark fruit is incredible.
Goodness of fig dark fruits caramel is beautiful. Malty finish is perfection. 
An excellent brune from Belgium. Blessed to have this bottle to myself ^,,^

Appearance: Clear amber/brown with a billowing 5 finger thick ivory head.
Aroma: Dried fig, raisin, prune, orange peel, caramel/toffee, marzipan, grassy, and floral, with vinous notes verging on brandy.
Taste: Medium sweetness, bitterness and sourness. Dried fruit medley with a toffee sweetness and vinous brandy like taste.
Palate: Thick texture and a medium/full body and mouthfeel, with prickly carbonation. The finish was abrupt and astringent, it was initially sweet but developed into bitterness and a slight fruity tartness.
Comments: Absolutely gorgeous one of the best beers I have tried. Left a glass lace.

Shared a bottle with a friend before, first time for myself. 

Pours huge head which slowly dissipates. Deep brown colour. 

A huge smell of both dark fruits and caramel sweetness. 

Sweet fruit and spice with notable Belgian yeast. Toasted, sweet malt taste is quite special. The level of raisin and brown sugar complexity that you would expect from a quad! Very little alcohol taste except for a small amount of warmth towards the back of the palate. 

Smooth body with medium carbonation. 

Really punches above its weight; up there with the quads! Far better than a good few of the Trappist beers too - an essential!!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

2009 vintage from Knightly Spirits
Appearance - Brown body, some sediment, frothy head
Aroma - Yeast, chocolate, French bread, raisins, caramel
Taste - Vanilla, raisins, cherries, chocolate, nutty, rum cake

This is an insane brew - so complex and delicious while being balanced and drinkable. Towards the finish, flavors are sort-of meddled and I wish to try a fresher bottle next time.

In 750ml Bottle. Deep Reddish color with a nice foam. Rich taste like i expected it to be. Sweet but still very balanced and a long tasty finish. 
Deep and very mature. A great Beer!
If you want to smell & taste liquorice, this is your beer. Sour effect (infection?) in the back. Price/quality ratio: below par
UPDATED: SEP 29, 2013 On tap at le sur mesure in Nantes. Dark ruby colour. Medium carbonation. Medium body. Fruity and roasty. I will try again. Y

33 cl flaske, 9 %, købt i Belgisk Bryg, Emdrup, vinter 2013.
Flot lettere uklar rødbrun belgisk ale med brunt skum. Lækker aroma af småkage, rosin og sveske. 
Skøn, lidt cremet og tykflydende mundfølelse med lang god eftersmag af alkoholen. I smagspaletten, som er god fyldig, mødes man først af en let sødme, som går over i en middel sødme. Middel kulsyreindhold. En rigtig dejlig belgisk ale, som dog er i den sødere afdeling. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Unique but not all I expected. Very malty and some sweetness on the nose. Cool deep ruby color but no head. Poured like wine or juice. Average weight and smooth feel. Below average carbonation. Anything more wouldnt have worked. Malty sweet alcoholic flavors. Some burnt sugar and fruit. This might require a second visit.

Espuma beige que desaparece rápidamente. Si sos rápido disfrutarás de un aroma afrutado que se desvanece inmediatamente dando paso a los aromas propios del género. Sabor muy equilibrado, se agradece que no sea tan dulce como otras triples.

deep brown red with nice off-white head. Boring aroma of belgian yeast, roasted malts and some licorice. very nice oily medium palate and small carbonation. aftertaste is roasted, licorice, alcohol and some flowery hops. Overall: Very nice. Good taste,palate and aftertaste. boring belgian yeast aroma.

Brown color, huge beige head. Aroma of molasses, caramel, raisins, dark fruits, candy sugar, muscavado sugar, liquorice. Taste is medium sweet, a lot of dark fruits flavor. Medium body, creamy texture, lively carbonation. Just amazing!

330 ml bottle at home, poured into a tulip glass. ABV 9%
Deep red ruby colour on the body, to the point it looks almost brown. Almost two fingers of off-white head, with some beige shades. Average retention.
Very nice aroma, full of dark fruits. Plums, grapes, a bit of roasted aromas, some coffee too. V.ery complicated.
Great taste as well, also very complex. Sweet at first, it ends with a light bitterness. Red grapes that give it a light wine taste, dark ripe fruits,, roasted malts, a bit of vanilla on the finish, burnt wood as the description says, sugars. Really really great and it becomes even better as it warms up. 
Medium body, good carbonation. 
Great beer, can easily be compared with the great trappist ones.

At Epic Beer Fest 2013. Clear dark copper under a generous foamy beige head. Aroma is nutty and earthy sweet with perhaps a bit of dates. Flavor is quite earthy and a bit bitter, with earthy bitterness and hoppiness trying to balance with rustic earthy toffee. A bit too bitter overall
UPDATED: MAR 17, 2015 What an amazing beer! Its has a very original spicy taste of malt, wood and sweet bitterness. A unique touch that only the Abbaye des Rocs beers have.
From notes. Bottle from de hopduvel. Pours red / brown with a tan head. aroma of malt, sweetness, yeast, caramel, and dark fruit. Taste of malt, dark fruits, caramel, yeast, and spice. Nice brew

Brune un rien rougeâtre, effervescence légère, mousse qui tombe dans la minute. Doux arômes de chocolat et de malts rôtis dès le départ. Côté goût: caramel, légèrement réglisse, fruits foncés et sucre candi. Alcool tout aussi légèrement présent. Classe et complexe!

33 cl bb 15/03/2015. Mahogany with a quarter inch of lasting foam. Nose is spicy dark bread, dry cocoa, raisin, cherry, a hint of charred grain. Tastes of coffee, cherry, prunes, blackberry, dark chocolate. Medium body is a little too fizzy at times, well balanced, and shows a bit of the abv.

Bottle 33cl. Small off white head. Quite good carbonation. Red brown color, a bit hazy. Aroma is plum, raisins with a metallic touch. Flavour is maple syrup, wild berries, caramel, figs and prune.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPad

Brown pour, huge head that dissipates quickly. Fig, raisin, yeast in the aroma. Fairly sweet tasting - Dark fruits - fig, date, prune, raisin, brown sugar, yeast, caramel, earthy. Medium body, good carbonation.
Surprising it has no sugar, it is very sweet with sugar and brown sugar and yeast. This particular bottle had a ridiculous amount of yeast. Medium body. Some dark fruit.

Pours dark brown with some ruby notes in it, one finger off white creamy head. Aroma is dark fruits, sweetness, yeast, figs. Taste has all of those components, bread. medium to full body. Nice mouthfeel, medium carbonation, alcohol is well hidden. Complex and well balanced.
Dyp mørk rød farve med et gyllent skum. Fin duft av malt. God smak av frukt, malt, sjokolade, kaffe og honning. Balansert og lite Karbonert. Vinmonopolet.
God frisk duft, nøttebrun farge.  Friskt på smak med en liten anelse syrlighet.  En liten søtlig ettersmak setter en ekstra piff på smaken.
Nice little head. Smell of nice sugary caramel and malts. Dry malty caramelish taste with some fruits in the end. This was actually better when it was quite cold.

UPDATED: FEB 8, 2014 33cl bottle. Rating #300!
APPEARANCE: brown beer, small rather unstable brownish head.
NOSE: very fruity and pleasant nose, reminds me a little of a red wine, some wood, even some bourbon, 
TASTE: strong taste in general, has a nice sweetness in it, some wood, rather fruity again, lots of burned malts, very complex and balanced taste! Amazing beer and a lot of taste for its 9°
Chocolate and champagne in the aroma. I miss a bit more bitterness in the taste, but this is nice and well-balanced.
Bottle 0.33l at Mallaskukko, Turku. BBE 27/09/2014. Colour is clear orange with small white head. Aromas and flavours: Fruits, raisins, plums, caramel, spices and malts.

Overall, one hell of a beer. Delectable, sorry melt and fruit characters up front with light almost subtle sliced notes with sweetness throughout, molasses and brown sugar malts on my first so with sweet sugary fruits of raisin, prunes and Concord grapes. Exquisite balance and mouthfeel is smooth and warming. Overall, just out of the park.
Rödbrun dimmig öl med med ett lätt smutsvitt skum. Doften är ganska söt med mörkt socker, russin, mandel lätt jästighet, alkohol och kryddighet. Samma återkommer i smaken.

Bottle. Crazy fizz on pouring and quick foamy off white head. Foody, sweet, funky as fuck veggie aroma. But tasty! A complex malt sweetness that falls into a boozy light taste. Basically, it comes in strong and leaves lighter. It's so interesting and has figs, all kinds of fruit, choc, coffee, and you can go and on and on....

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours murky brown with low yellow white head
Aromas of port, fudgy malts, raisins, hints of liqourise, belgi yeast
Lovely taste of caramel, tar, port, special b, cherries, dark fruits
Absolutely lovely!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a brown to ruby colour. Strongly carbonated that stirs up lots of sediments. Decent head that dissipates quickly, but leaves some lacing. Aroma of dark fruits, malty and a hint of alcohol. Medium body. Flavour is sweet malts, fruits, nuts and some alcohol as it warms up. But its an easy drink in spite of its abv. Very good Belgian strong ale.

Bottle 0,33l. Pours reddish brown with a off-white head which vanishes quickly. Good lacing. Aroma is dominated by yeast, fruit, skunk, citrus, and a hint of alcohol heaviness. The taste is quite sweet.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

33cl bottle BB 01/2015. Extraordinarily balanced triptych of (South-)Belgian brewing: rich, deep, complex dark and red fruit tastes (figs, prunes); heavy caramel malts and heavy-duty yeasts levitated into near-imperceptible, round and mature 9 ABV; grassy and herbal hop bitterness working in accord to provide a strong and spicy back drop for these fruity yeast chords to bounce off. Smoother than, but faintly reminiscent of Chimay Bleu, in the same enlightened league as St.Bernardus Prior 8. Not a beer I would naturally reach for more than once a year, but from a gastronomical point of view this could be a cooks many-purpose secret weapon.

Bottle sample at our place. Thanks DSG. Best Before date 2008, aged at DSGs cellar since 2007. Murky brown with tan ring and some floaties, nutty, very fruity aroma - ripe, some spice and old wine and prune, too. Tastes sweet, fruity and a little spicy. Full-bodied, smooth and a little, just a little, carbonated. Long fruity finish.

750 ml bottle served in a St. Bernardus snifter. 

A: Poured with a thick creamy light tan head on top of a reddish-brown body that has lumps of dark soft solids floating about. Not appealing, but seems to have no nasty effects on feel or flavor, and settle to the bottom anyway so that they could be avoided ... that is, if the beer wasnt so darn good youll want every drop. Still, a downgrade on looks which remains high due to the stellar head and lacing.  

S: bready-fruity-floral aroma, with hints of cumin, orange juice, and champagne. Some additional, more earthy and less attractive alcohol esters. 

Taste: rich, even given the aroma, and mainly fruity and spicy, although the flavor is subtle and complex.  Making appearances are raisins and dates, dark bread, coriander, cumin, ginger and orange peel. Theres a faint hint of smoke in the aftertaste.  This beer is rather sweet but the bitter/sweet blend seems on the spot.  

M: Body seems medium-full and, at the same time, light and airy.  Very very  soft. Only a soft alcohol heat despite 9% ABV. 

O: superb[ a real treat.

Rouge foncé avec une mousse beige moyenne qui se rétréci vite, laissée un peu que reste jusqau fin. Larôme du sucre candi et malt. Le goût est un peu sucrée, il y a du malt, du caramel, du molasse, et peut être un peu de fruits noir mais très peu. Cest extremement onctueux et il ny a pas quune trace dalcool. Pour un abv de 9% cest incroyable.
Bottle. Pours a hazy dark amber color with a longlasting off-white head. Sweet malty dark fruit aroma. Sweet malty caramel flavor with hints f dark fruit. Sweet malty warming finish.

Pours reddish brown with a off white head that dissipated quickly. Aroma is pear, raisin, caramel, yeast and earthy.  Taste is sweet with a tart finish.  Medium bodied,  sticky finish, thick mouth feel.

330ml bottle. Pours a reddish brown with a decent-sized off-white head. Aroma is caramel, loads of it. Some cola-like features, light alcohol. Pear and spice as well. Taste is a lot of caramel, a good helping of spiciness as well. Spiciness, not spiced - Comes through the malt, hops and yeast not with extraneous ingredients. Some herbalness as well as pear. Semi sweet. Palate is fairly light with quite a bit of carbonation. Definitely would drink again.

330ml bottle from Vinmonopolet. Pours reddish brown with tiny sediments floating around like tadpoles before settling. Tiny off-white head which vanishes quickly. Good lacing. Aroma is dominated by yeast, fruit, skunk, citrus, and a hint of alcohol heaviness. The taste is quite sweet, and even though its good, it becomes a little much after half a glass. Not that I was unable to finish. Palate is delicious and foamy.

330 ml bottle from Vinmonopolet. Dark reddish brown. Clear, but there was a lot of yeast in the bottle, which is not unlike what Ive seen earlier. Its been a very long time since Ive tried this beer. And it was great the last time, as it is this time. Intense malty aroma with black pepper and ripe apples. Complex sugary flavours with toffee and caramel. Body is surprisingly light, which makes the beer very drinkable. Malty and rich. More apples in the finish, almost cidery, but not dry nor that sweet. Overall a fantastic Belgian dubbel-like beer. Awesome.

Delicious malty aroma of dark fruits with a hint of chocolate. Can smell the alcohol a bit as well. Taste is delicious dark fruity malt - taste reminds me of a doppelbock as the Belgian yeast doesnt seem to be as present as other Belgians Ive tried. Bit of alcohol in the flavour as well. One of the easiest drinking and well-balanced Belgian ales Ive had!

Bottle 330ml @ home
Pours dark reddish brown with a off-white head. Aroma has notes of malt, chocolate, caramel, alcohol and dried fruits. Taste is medium to heavy sweet and light bitter with a long sweet caramel and fruity finish. Body is full, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.

750 ml bottle into chalice, best before 2/12/2013.  Pours moderately cloudy reddish brown color with a nice 2 finger fairly dense and fluffy cream colored head with good retention, that reduces to a small cap that lingers.  Spotty foamy lacing clings on the glass, with plenty of streaming carbonation retaining the head.  Aromas of big raisin, prune, fig, apple, caramel, molasses, toast, toffee, brown bread, pepper, light clove, and earthy yeast spiciness.  Incredible aromas with big complexity and great balance of dark malt and fruity/spicy yeast ester notes; with good strength.  Taste of raisin, fig, prune, apple, caramel, molasses, toast, toffee, pepper, light clove, brown bread, and yeast earthiness.  Lingering notes of light and dark fruits, caramel, molasses, toast, toffee, brown bread, pepper, light clove, and yeast earthiness on the finish for a while.  Fantastic complexity of malt and spicy/fruity yeast esters; with a great balance of malt/spiciness and no cloying flavors after the finish.  Medium-high carbonation and medium-full bodied; with a creamy, slick, and moderately prickly mouthfeel that is great.  Alcohol is very well hidden with only a slight warming noticed after the finish.  Overall this is a fantastic Belgian strong dark ale!  Great complexity and balance of malt and fruity/spicy yeast esters; and very smooth to sip on.  A highly enjoyable offering.

First half of the bottle pours a clear brown (ruby maybe like the brewer would say) while second half is murky brown with a lot of floaters. Aroma is really nice with powerful molasse and raisins notes. Taste is quite sweet but not cloying. Flavors are spicy, with a bit of cinnamon and lots of cloves. A good beer and a beer that ages well it seems!

15.04.2013. 0,33l Bottle. Vinmonopolet Haugesnd. Brown colour with white head. Unclear and hazy. Aroma of sweet dark malts. Very nice sweet rich body with good firm strength from both the malts and from alcohol. A real warmer. Soft carbonation and soft smooth bitterness. Very lovely and soft beer. My father died one and a half year ago, today would have been his sixty first birtday. Cheers dad!
About as good as dubbels get. Very rich, slick mouthfeel, some understated hoppyness but the flavor is dominated by the dark fruit and caramel malts.

0.33cl bottle. Pours dark brown with almost no head. Ohh what aromas and flavour. So aroma is fruity, sweet, some yeast. Flavour is very complex like all top rated Belgian beers: sweet, fruity (plums), maybe some chocolate but that was a quick feeling. Like all outstanding beers each time you take a sip you get a different flavour. Amazing

Bottle. Pours a nice reddish brown with nearly no head. Estery aroma, bubblegum, dark fruits amd dried fruits, leather.  Taste has some alcohol, caramel, fruity esters. Quite sweet and full with a slightly bitter finish. Quite similar to westy 12  but not really my bag
Fruity malt aroma. Pours brown with a tan head. Medium sweet, light bitter taste. Full bodied with a lingering finish. Very nice beer.

UPDATED: AUG 29, 2013 bottle @ delirium cafe, Brussels. WOW! profumo di caramello, frutta candita e zucchero di canna. incredibile dato che non cè alcuna aggiunta di zuccheri! sottofondo di malti tostati, ma quasi impercettibile. la schiuma è color capuccino molto vaporosa e fa dei bellissimi merletti di bruxelles. frizzantezza perfetta, solletica la linga e non disturba. corpo quasi oleoso. il gusto è incredibile. praticamnete un vino rosso, con note di liquerizia, cioccolato fondente e luppolo solo sul finale. Il retrogusto p lungo e oleoso, quasi da sciroppo. Diventa una droga, ordinatene già 2.

330 ml bottle. Slightly hazy (and thats almost unusually clear to be an Abbaye de Rocks)   deep amber body with a big, foamy off-white head. Aroma of caramel malt, toast, dry fruit, candy sugar and a hint of warming alcohol. Flavor is sweet, caramel malt, dry fruit, candy sugar, toast, a hint of light acidic berries, slightly spicy and warming alcohol. Fine body and long aftertaste. A nice Belgium dubbel, definitively on the sweeter side.

0.33l bottle. Yeah, its actually really brown in the glass this one, almost murky with some big sediments laying on the bottom of the glass, and it has a lovely looking big off-white lasting head thats lacing gently down the sides of the glass. Oh, the aroma is just lovely sweet and packed! Tons of dried dark fruits, dates, figs, brown candied sugar, a little bit of alcohol and something almost yeasty. The mouthfeel on this is best described as smooth and velvety clouds. So smooth on the tongue that I almost dont want to swallow it, and the flavors are also fantastic and my god the flavors are so integrated and equalizing. That sweetness found in the aroma is also really present in the flavor. Milky sweet with a dark fruitiness blended with vanilla and dark candy. Really balanced and complex. One classy jazz beer and just a wonderful brune all the way. Not often I finish a beer and immediately think to myself, I really really want another bottle of this RIGHT Now! 25.03.2013
UPDATED: JUL 13, 2013 Good vinous color, creamy white head, light sweet aroma, taste is sweet of caramel malt, with smooth body, no hops notes, very good beer, much drinkable!

UPDATED: JUN 9, 2013 Bottle at home, from BE
AROMA: dark fruits and grapes, raisin, brown sugar, wood
APPEARANCE: brown, extremely cloudy, flaky, white head
TASTE: medium sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour
PALATE: medium body, sticky, average carbonation, bitter, long finish, 
OVERALL: well-balanced brown abbey with wine-like aromas, high ABV hardly noticeable.

Pours a very dark brown to copper body with lots and lots of sediments of all sizes, making this a dirty-looking and very cloudy beer. The frothy, very light-brown head isnt very big, and reduces relatively fast to a partially covering film of foam, ok lacing. The aroma is strong and sweet with dark dried fruits, dark candi sugar (which the label clearly states that is not added to this beer) and belgian yeast in the back, also traces of dust. I had expected a bit more from this beer, but I do have a cold and a light sinusitis, so I might have myself to blame... The taste is moderate sweet and light bitter. Quite strong flavours of sweet sugary dark dried fruits and vanilla, further back I get caramel, Belgian yeast, dark candi sugar again, perfume and a whiff of banana. Medium to full body, oily texture, moderate carbonation. The alcohol is incredibly well integrated. A nice beer, although definitely on the sweet side. I should probably try this one again when Im feeling better, maybe Ill find it even more interesting then. 
[33 cl bottle, enjoyed 20 months before BB date, from Vinmonopolet Ullevål, Oslo]

Heavy sweet, quite fruity, heavy on the caramel, dark malts and sweet raisins. Moderate bitter finish. A highly drinkable belgian. Beer from a tulip glass @ home;March 12,2013

Bottle 33 cl, BBE 04/09/2014. Pours brown in color with a creamy tan head which stays on as a cap for a long time. Roasted malts, light notes of yeast, some dadels in aroma. Sweet malty, some dough and light fruitiness in taste. Some garden berries in taste as well. Malty and light peppery spicy in finish. Smooth and easy to drink.

UPDATED: NOV 16, 2015 Color rubino scuro con soffice cappello di schiuma beige. Aroma con sentori di toffee, uvetta, lievito e liquirizia; gusto maltoso e avvolgente, mediamente dolce con note di frutta sciroppata e zucchero caramellato. Corpo medio, frizzantina, morbida al palato ma il finale è insolitamente breve. In ogni caso, strong ale da manuale.

Excellent Belgian strong ale!  Dark, opaque brown, with thin beige oil slick head. Aroma is cola, wood, nuts, chocolate and prunes. Taste is dark chocolate , raisins, roast grain and oak barrel. Bitter aftertaste clings to the palate, mouthfeel is perfect for the style, very slick. A masterpiece.

Bottle from Vinmonopolet. Pours dark ruby with a small head. Inviting sweet  malty aroma, dark fruits. Taste is strong sweet, light spicy, and fruity. Special beer with session qualities, but watch out, it is a lot stronger than suggested by the drinkability, classy beer.

33cl bottle from Vinmonopolet, Storo. Pours dark brown with a tan head. Malty and fruity aroma with caramel, dark fruits and hints of yeast, alcohol and spices. Faint notes of vanilla or wood too.Sweet, malty and fruity with somewhat dry and lightly bitter finish. Its smooth and dangerously drinkable. Warming alcohol and definitely a nice beer for this time of the year.

Pours dark, rich brown. Lots of sediment. Aromas of malt, yeast, and dried fruit. Flavor is very rich and robust. In particular, the finish is really long and complex. The only downside is the intense amount of sediment, like Im talking borderline chunks...just a bit much. Otherwise, solid brew. Interesting and complex.

Belgian style beer tasting night. Bottle, exploded on opening (3 days settle). Amber beer a lot of sedimentation with three foot gushing head followed by no head. Aroma of dark fruits. Taste is rich dark fruits, sweet treacle and liquorice all sorts. A very good beer a pity about the explosion, it may have been better if this didnt happen.
user_location: West Bromwich (Yorkshire Expat), West Midlands, ENGLAND

text:
Colour: cloudy, hazy translucent deep wine red and purple tinge with flaky yeast sediments.

Appearance: Excellent two finger head with lasting beige foam and very frothy; Excellent, sticky lacing and fizzy carbonation.

Smell: Very fragrant aroma of dark fruit and floral which can be smelt half a feet away once poured; Aroma includes plum, raisin, banana, vanilla, malt, liquorices and light alcohol.

Taste: very nice sweet and hoppy taste of strong raisin, plum, banana, caramel, toffee, yeast, cloves, light alcohol and herbal hops.

Yeast sediments: they are chunky and grainy, so its optional to pour them into the glass but I did, which makes the tasting much more rustic, tasty and enjoyable. In fact, the yeast is so sticky to the grass it looks like cinnamon powder on cappuccino and I have to scrape them with a dessert spoon! :)

Body: Mid body, slick palate.

Mouth Feel: taste profile is dominated by nice and light alcohol as background with long sweet maltyness followed by light yeast (from sediments) and cloves, and ends with nice floral and herbal hoppiness at low dose typical of Belgian ales.
 
Hop Bitterness: mild and comfy - is manifested throughout the taste profile not just at the end, a very nice feature!

Booziness: the 9% abv sounds daunting, but unlike other BSA booze bombs, this one works up ever so slowly. It doesnt kick in long after 30 - 40 minutes. It has a simmering feel more than anything else. Excellent!

After taste: Slightly dry, very nice and easy to mouth.

Comments: After Chimay Blue, this one is another stand out winner in the sea of BSA. It has beautiful head, rich yeast sediments, nice and strong fragment aroma, rich taste profile, excellent booze management, tasty hops, rustic yeast character, and I can go on and on. The lack of creamy palate as in Chimay Blue may be a minus, and that doesnt change my opinion to place it as one of my top 10 brews. Highly recommended. Do I really need to say that? ;)

Small bottle at AdR tasting at Jekylls, Oslo. Dark caramel colour, edging to purple, with a small white head which leaves after a short while. Its very sweet on the nose, malts, caramel, fruity. The taste is dominated by the full body of sweetness, caramel, malts, prunes, raisins, and a slightly round finish. One of the most enjoyable beers Ive had for a while.
330 ml bottle, rated from old tasting notes. Pours deep amber with small head. Aroma is sweet with loads of fruit. Taste is very rich and full, dried fruits and alcohol.

16th January 2012Cloudy brown beer, little pale tan head. Airy palate, softish. Minerals. All about the malt here - slightly tangy and with a little cream. A trace of dried fruits. Semi dry finish. Decent for the style.

33 cl. bottle.  Pours a reddish brown with a nice biege head.  Sweet aroma of malt, yeast, caramel, and fruit.  Taste is sweet malt, dark fruits, caramel, yeast, and spice.  Well balanced with a nice finish.  Top notch!!
Pale brown colour. Lots of complexity in aroma including dust, toasty malt and yeast. Flavour has some burnt candy bittersweetness, dark dried fruit and alcohol. Full-on flavour and quite intense.

33cl bottle served at room temperature and poured a deep brown colour with a good size tan head which did not last.Fruity aroma with some roast malt.Tastes of malt,chocolate,caramel and fruit with the alcohol well in the background.Well balanced and highly enjoyable beer.

UPDATED: MAR 6, 2013 Deep brown with foamy head. Aroma and flavour is caramel and malts. The taste takes this beauty to another level though - deep rich toffee hits the back of the palate. Big mouthfeel is catapulted by the medium carbonation. Great finish, great beer.

caramel, chocolate, coffee, licorice.
Birra equilibrata con un favoloso mix di aromi. Ottima al palato, Lascia un gusto persistente e gradevole.

Bottle. Aroma fresh pears, cherry, raisins, peach. Taste fruity, light pear and peach, light sweet warm alcohol, light caramel. Refreshing considering the ABVB. Deep red colour. Alcohol hidden well. Finish fruity, very light touch of hops. Exceptional.

Enjoyed on 10/18/2011

Poured into a wide goblet from a bottle.  Bartender at Delerium Cafe in Brussels did his best to keep sediment out of the beer but still had large chunks of yeast floating in a rich, very dark brown.

Minimal head, no lacing.  Fairly mild nose of roasted malt, chocolate, and vanilla.

More vanilla on the palate, with light hoppiness and good carbonation.  Chocolate, raisins.  Very good, very balanced.  Almost no alcohol present in the taste - excellent beer!
Nice white/beige head when poured into a glass.  Red-brown in color. Very sweet and fruity aroma and taste.   Full bodied and creamy texture.  Great finish.

Bottle. Dark red-brown hazy body with an average to sparse beige-tan head. Aroma/taste: moderately strong flavours of chocolate, raisins, spices, plums, soy sauce and rum; balanced with a slightly chocolatey bitter finish and just a touch of sourness. Medium bodied and well carbonated.

large frothy light brown head. good lacing. mostly diminishing. flat thick dark amberish-brown body. aroma: alcohol, red wine, dark chocolate, heavy malt.  if and ff: moderate sweet light bitter; long duration. palate: medium full body, creamy texture, medium carbonation, metallic moderate alcoholic finish. aroma frutas vermelhas, lembrando ameixa fresco, maravilhoso sabor maltado de frutas vermelhas, 290 s

Copper color with foamy beige head. A yeasty and toffee aroma  Bready malty flavor with caramel and hazelnut. A very solid brune but not in the 100 percentile IMHO.

Bottle from Beermerchants. Slow gusher! It pours cloudy deep mahogany brown with a small fizzy beige head. The nose is wood, earth, toast, hint of smoke, spice, dark fruit and caramel. The taste is caramel, chocolate, wood, spice, dark fruit, raisin, toast, dried fig, plum, earth, cola, some bitterness and underlying alcohol warmth with a dry finish. Im glad Tommann exists, cos this is another fizzer. Stood for literally 5 mins by the sink catching the froth as it squizzed out the side of a barely opened cap. Was nice. Not sure how this brewery has got such exceptional ratings. But their beverages are tasty.

Bottle @ home. Delayed gusher (my least favorite kind!). The pours deep brown with a medium off-white head that slowly settles. The nose is big orange liqueur, chocolate sauce, plenty of fruity esters, spice cabinet, plenty of belgian yeast funkiness. Bruised red fruits. The taste is spiced christmas cake, more orange peel and red berry. Some roasted nut, rich caramel, plenty of chocolate malt. Long, slightly hot finish. The bodys smooth and rich. The ABVs hidden very well. Overall, a pretty excellent Belgian Strong Ale. Worth checking out.

UPDATED: AUG 18, 2013 This is one of the very few beers that I give a all most perfect score. It seems like no one else knows about this beer, but let me tell you, its a beauty. Burgundy color, ripe fruit aroma, amazing sweet-sour contrasting taste. As good as it gets.

Bottle. A very nice red when poured with a decent brown/dark beige head. Aroma is sweet, I could tell it had some caramel and fruit. Taste is caramel, toffee, some fruit and slight spice.  Overall a malty treat. I suppose having a 100 rating would lead me to say its overrated, but separate that from the fact that its an incredibly tasty beer. 9% abv.

UPDATED: OCT 11, 2012 Poured into a Chalice Glass from 330 ml bottle.

App--- dark brown clour with big head ( 2 fingers, beige) long lasting

Brown body, khaki head. Aroma has fruity vinous notes, caramel, chocolate and our bruin style acidic smell. Raisins and chocolate with yeast on taste.

33 cl bottle.

33 cl bottle, BB 24/11/2013, LOT: L113801611. Sampled on September 15, 2012Poured super careful by experience from other beers from this brewery, only poured perhaps 7-8 cl, still have huge amounts of big nasty looking floaters/proteins in there. Copper color, tan head. Acidic to sour, nail polish remover, paint thinner, fruit pith scent. Sweet, sort of roasted, wet cardboard, minerals, harsh grainy bitter taste. Warming alcohol. Hazy reddish-brown with big, fine-bubbled, foamy tan head / Have to let this  one warm up and the CO2 settle, then sweet nose of caramel, cooked dark fruit, leather, and wood / Medium body, sweet and malty, light hopping, and good finish / Musty flavors of caramel, leather, dates, raisins, wood, and red pepper / Good, but overrated.

Interesting Belgian Strong Ale. Its different from the others. It pours a dark brown/red color (trappist glass) with a small beige head. The smell reminds me of a schwartz beer with its smokey sweet malt being the strongest. Roasted caramel malt flavor with a medium bitter bite. Bubbly mouthfeel. Great flavor and different from others within the same category.

Bottle at home. Aroma is malty and sweet as is the flavor. The ingredients do not include added sugar, but still it has the sweetness I like in this style of beer. Quite bubbly. The seller said this is the best of the Abbaye des Rocs brand. He might be right. Would definitely drink this one again, but I will have to check out the others. Good stuff!

UPDATED: SEP 9, 2012 750 ml bottle. L111306352. BB 10/05/2014. From Belgium. Courtesy of Brandman.

Brown sugar, malt, mild bitterish hops and mild sourness in flavour.
Low carbonation.

UPDATED: SEP 8, 2012 Interesting beer with a fantastic beige foam very persistent, complex aromas of spicy, vinous and ripe fruit. The mouth is smooth and wraparound beer and it leave drink without brake.

UPDATED: MAR 1, 2013 Medium red-brown body, large off-white head, quickly receded, spotty lacing.  Nose is a blast of Belgian malts: dark fruit, caramel, candi sugar, fruitty yeast, and mild booze.  Flavor is similar with complex, bold malts really showing--never exhibiting any cloying traits or over-reaching richness.  This is really that good--a beer that somehow flies under the radar in terms of discussion and hype.
Pourd dark brown. Aroma consists of malt, caramel, fruits and raisins. Flavour is malty, fruity and spicy.

A dark, mahongy beer with a very big and beige head. Aroma is strongly dark fruity, some roastiness, raisins and dry spicyness, some earthyness. Bottle shared by ygtbsm94. Thanks Brad!

2006 Vintage

A: Light brown to dark orange in color, with a half inch of white, fluffy head that leaves a healthy amount of lacing. Some sediment can be seen floating in the beer.

S: Distinctly Belgian aroma, with scents of Belgian yeast, malt, fruits.

T: I was shocked by this beer. It was delicious. I will definitely be hooking myself up with some of this. A tantalizing Belgian yeast flavor in tandem with subtle fruits and a wonderful malt profile make this beer utterly delectable.

M: Smooth, creamy, and slightly sweet. Silky smooth on the palate. Age must have come into play, as this beer is just effortless to drink.

D: Slightly sweet, but I could definitely enjoy a full goblet of this.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 12-20-2010

This one has been sitting in the cellar for two three years. A dark ruby hazy brew that is quite turbid from all the yeast floating around. Very sweet vinous nose that I guess comes with age. The rich and intense taste is also sweet but is balanced by the high ABV and the fruity esters from the yeast. A very nice beer.

Dark ruby colour, faintly sour aroma reminiscent of burnt milk. First taste is a big flavour with chocolate and caramel. A faint acidity is balanced by sweet dry fruits. As it warms up hints of tobacco come into the flavour. A well crafted beer
This is a very good beer! A nice balance between bitter and sweet, even a bit sour? Notes of chocolat, raisins. Fruity and earthy. Full body, long finish!
Una gran cerveza con intenso aroma, buen sabor y fuerte de alcohol. Muy buena.

33cl bottle from BarleyWine. Batch L808 01267. Best before 2011-03-28. I was a bit I hadnt rated this before as Ive certainly tried it before. Ah well.
It poured a dark brown colour with a medium big head. Lots of yeast sediments.  Aroma is sweet with hints of malts and belgian yeast, but since the BB date has passed by over a year it has become slightly vinious as well. Some spices and hints of wet wood. Flavour has also deteriorated due to the BB date. Its still sweet and malty, but also vinious and wood. Some spice and alcohol. Wish I had a fresher bottle. Will have to try and re-rate later.
Taster @ SIB 2012. Pours muddy brown. Smells sweet like candy with an ever-so-subtle tartness that just feels like it belongs. Incredibly mellow. Not sure Ive ever had such a balanced beer.

Poured into a goblet. Best before 2010...oops. 

2.0 A: Fucker gushed on me big time. Dark brown color. Unthinkable amounts of yeast particulates and floaters throughout. Big frothy tan head. Retention is below average and no lacing is left. I know this would look much better if it didnt gush, but it did, and my score will reflect what I got. An ugly ass brew if Ive ever seen one.

4.5 S: The aroma, on the other hand, is quite fine. Perfect balance between sweetness, fruit, earth, and spice. Toasted malts to start this one off with a subtle nuttiness. Raisin and date fruits. Woody earthiness. Pepper spiciness with clove undertones. Sweetness from candi sugar residue. Well balanced with all the flavors in perfect harmony like any of the world class Belgians.

4.0 T: Taste is almost as good, but it seems hollow at times. Toastiness, nutty, earthy, woody, pepper and clove spice, raisin and date fruits. This is much drier than the nose suggests and I think a little more sweetness is just what this brew needs. That extra fermentation is likely the culprit. A little more maltiness would really balance the taste. Still, its very good.

2.5 M: Light to lighter medium body. Good spritzy carbonation and a pleasant creaminess. This could easily be a 4.5. But, it isnt because all those floaters are really offputting. I cant help but think Im drinking vomit every time a clump of something passes over and tickles my tongue.

3.5 D: While still very enjoyable, its clear to me that I need to find this brew fresh. In an unadultered form, I bet this is fantastic. When I do track another bottle down, Ill probably re-review.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 06-02-2012 03:16:12

Gusher alert! The result is a deep, unclear burgundy brown with hints of copper and beige foam, some small yeast particles floating in it.
The nose is powerful, a mix of alcohol (red wine like), plenty of sugars, roasted malts and something spiced - very, very nice and promising.
That promise is fully delivered in the taste which is very similar; strong attack, definitely alcohol but not excessive since the other flavours are equally present. Some sugars but more roast and above all spices. The end result is really complex.
The aftertaste tends more towards roast, smooth but not soft, quite malty in fact. A touch of bitterness brings further balance.
If you pour the yeast, it seems to add further punch.
Delicious brew!

Abbaye des Rocs.. rock around the clock... be bop a lulla... glôôôriâââ...
Un top de la gamme qui sannonce pour le mieux avec une étiquette soignée
dabbaye du Moyen Age, et blason sur la capsule avec mitre et crosse...
La microbrasserie na pas fait dans les détails avec du 9% abv, et une densité
importante. 
Des couleurs de châtaigne foncée avec des reflets ocres.
Un pétillant par vagues importantes à gros bouillons depuis le fond.
Une mousse beige de toute beauté à gros flocons en bas et crémeuse en haut.
Des arômes de céréales et cèpes à tête noire, avec de la levure et des pruneaux.
Une texture soyeuse à souhait, superbe.
Un 1er goût sur des fruits confits avec une légère pointe de charbon. Une classe
de trappiste...
Une 2ème bouche avec une pointe de porto millésimé sur du fondu de céréales
et des levures fines.
Une 3ème avec un lit de fruits mûrs et du bois de fût vineux, joints à une pointe 
de cognac grande champagne...
La levure est dun très bel arôme avec un grand fondu des nuances fruitées.
La longueur est crémeuse et suave, de superbe classe, fruits et bois.
A partir de ce point, on sait que la finale sera de rêve pur, on se laisse faire par
le nectar divin, qui coule jusque dans vos veines, en vous expliquant ce quest
le paradis sur terre. Un paradis de saveurs où le fondu des saveurs et le crémeux
se rejoignent en une sarabande folle.
Les mots sont trop petits à ce moment, parce quon voudrait tout dire et seules
les impressions et les sensations sont miraculeuses.
O plénitude, quand tu nous tiens .

Pours a dark brown colour with a very tall frothy off-white head. Aroma is very complex. Sweet malt, dark fruits, plums, caramel with some nuts and spices. Taste is also just as complex with more of the dark fruits, caramel and nuts with some spices leading to a sweet fruity finish. Alcohol hidden well. Really surprised with this one. Loved it!
Attenzione alla schiuma, questa birra appena aperta è peggio di una fontana. Ma poi è fantastica fa bere, ben corposa

330 ml bottle. Pours a deep cloudy, rich red/brown with huge head that dissipates slowly leaving thick lacing. Aromas of warm spice, dark roasted malts, dark pitted fruit and raisins. Very complex, creamy, and warm but alcohol is well hidden. Flavors of toffee, dark cherry and dates, spice, and bit of woodiness. Beautifully balanced. Easily one of the top ten beers.

Pours deep copper/amber with high carbonation and a big frothy head. Aromas of bread, yeast, cherry, plum and raisin. Flavors of spice, wood tones, mellowed cherry, slightly nutty, hints of figs and raisin. I really like how the flavors are mellowed and more meshed together comparable to an aged belgian. Its medium sweet as well. Nicely done.

Rich molasses and tar nose with chocolate covered cherry accents, candi, and marzipan, moderate strength. Cloudy brown, thick yellow head, no lacing. Marzipan, chocolate syrup, fudge, raisins and figs are very prominent. Light tobacco notes are also present. Fudge and figs remain on the palate. Exceptionally well balanced. Alcohol is well concealed. I had intended to buy a four pack, but due to a miscommunication with the shop that had to special order it, I ended up getting a full case. Best mistake I ever made.

Colore bruno, schiuma molto persistente ma non troppo cremosa. Stupisce anche dallodore con note pronunciate di malto e leggere di frutti di bosco. E una birra piacevole nonostante i 9° e in bocca ha sempre qualcosa in più di una belgian strong ale. Corpo vivo, marcato e molto ben bilanciato con il fruttato. Addirittura qualche nota di affumicato. Il retrogusto amaro completa una birra davvero ben riuscita. Da provare

Ok, two things 1) People! learn how to pour a beer! Mine is quite clear and sparkling. 2) Theres no "Abbaye" on my bottles - theyre labled "Brasserie des Rocs." Brilliant reddish copper colored with a self-regenerating creamy head. Aromas are rich and enticing - spicy-sweet with some fruit, apples and pear. Smooth, rich and strong fruity flavors. A little flinty bitterness. Sweet/tart finish. Subtle alcohol. These brewers really know how to construct a beer.

pours dark murky brown, floaters with a very nice dark beige head, excllent retention and lacing. dried dark fruits, spices, pepper, roasted malts, aged malts, leather, hint of acidity, some sweetness but good supporting hops - earthy, somewhat citrusy. soft and lively carbonation, medium long grassy finish. awesome!

You really know what your getting with these big belgian strongs.  Youre gonna get a nutty rich dark fruit filled sweet beer with a dry finish.  Chunks of yeast were unappetizing but still a tasty brew,
Typical belgian dark ale, on the nutty side. Tons of yeast floating around.
Above average, murky brown in color.  Taste was fairly simplex, with definite grape.  Decent carbonation in the mouthfeel.. not bad overall.
Sampled at Larsniclas testing. Pours amber with a big light brown head. Smells chocolate and caramel malty. Tastes strawbarry, caramel malty and with a bitter muddy finish.

Bottle. Bit of a gusher this one. Lost half the bottle unfortunately. Pour is a deep dark brown with a huge dark brown head. Feel away super fast becoming non existent almost immediately. Aromas are very sweet showing dark sugars and treacle. A little light stone fruit sourness in the back ground. Some alcohol present as well. Flavours are also quite sweet. Some alcohol burn on the finish. Slightly thinner mouthfeel than expected.

I wanted (yet) another St Bernadus Christmas on tap, but the strength was just too high so I settled for a bottle of this on that fateful afternoon I first visited The Red Rose in Brugge (Dec 2011).

The 9% ABV being a whole 1% less than the St Bernadus I felt very righteous and the wife didnt notice the alcohol content (double bonus).

Nine tenths of the beer was poured for me into the glass, the remaining sediment infested tenth I swallowed at the end. The beer was a deep, deep brown, red, purple colour, mostly red I suppose: on top an off-white head that fades fair too swiftly.

The smells are mostly sweet: molasses and sugar on toast, there is also a yeasty, dirty aroma hidden away that comes out when the beer begins to warm in the glass.

This isnt a gulper; youve got to sip it: the flavours are complex and confusing. Sweet up front with a malt flavour, leaning towards burnt candy floss and treacle tarts as you get into it.

Rich, but not as thick as you might imagine, certainly different to what I expected.

Strange brew, would have preferred another St Bernadus to be honest!

750mL bottle, pours an opaque dark red with a small beige head. Aroma of dark fruits, syrup, caramel malts and yeast. Flavour of maple syrup, caramel, dark fruits (especially berries, prunes and dates), and yeast. Quite complex and full-bodied, with medium-high carbonation. Delicious.

From Backlog @ bit aged Kulminator 
Head: white, firm, medium 
Colour: dark brown 
Smell: nuty, candy sirup, bit of alcohol, bot of yeast, malts and bit roasted malts, raisins 
Taste: very deep rich Strong Ale  with a good balance on the palate, mmmm
Bottle from Klooster.  Brown pour with bubbly white head.  Aroma Is caramel, malt and fruit.  Flavor Is the same with some alcohol warmth.

Pours a dirty brown with a quick fizzy white top that disappears.  Aroma is faint but mostly malt and some raisin.  Taste is purple fruit, raisin and fig.  Nicely carbonated, with lots of malt and a small bitterness lingers.  Nice beer.

En kraftfull brune som är stark, söt och fyllig för genren och snarare liknar en dubbel. Rejäl maltkropp som skulle mått bra att lagras några år. En lite humleprofil som drar åt malört/vermouth eller bränt trä. God men inte bland bättre dubblar jag druckit.

UPDATED: JUN 13, 2012 Una buona bruma! Aroma speziato e floreale e di liquirizia. Al palato si sbilancia verso il dolce con il malto tostato, la liquirizia, prugne e un tocco di zucchero candito. Alla fine si percepisce anche un pò di latte di cocco!  Niente male, anche se un pò sbilanciata verso il dolce. Riprovata: Un pò stucchevole, molto alcolica e poco bilanciata. Chissà se conservandola un pò in cantina migliori...

27/05/2011 750ml bottle. Bruna scura, densa, con riflessi di miele alla nocciola, schiuma bianco sporca poco persistente. Aroma intensissimo di malto caramellato, con note fruttate e speziate evidenti. In bocca è complessa, caramellata e dolcissima, forse un po troppo. Molto malto, un fruttato evidente, note di cioccolato e liquirizia, con finale appena amarognolo. Corpo pieno, carbonazione soft. Una eccellente belgian strong ale ma forse un po inferiore alle aspettative.

Bottle from Beers of Europe
Bottle gushed on opening....dark ruby brown...big frothy off white head with good lacing
Aroma - rich fruity dark malts...alcohol soaked dark fruits...raisins...some floral notes...light aromatic spicy notes...yeast....sweet sherry
Taste - rich fruity dark malts....rich dark caramel....dark fruits..raisins...some bready malts....complex yeast esters - fruity and floral...some herbal notes...quite spicy...hint of port and sherry...bit aromatic....very complex...alcohol very well hidden...great taste
Palate - Very high carbonation - settled down to medium.....full body...smooth rich soft textured malts...bit sticky texture. Finish - rich dark fruity caramel malts and aromatic spices in the linger with a bit of extra bitterness
Overall - Great tasting complex Belgian with an interesting aromatic spicy note

(750ml)im enjoying this , not really dissecting it but fuck me its pretty sophisticated .   Ive read about how Godly this beers nose is in reviews , i must say an  anticlimatic  aroma  . Not forthcoming as a stench.  It looks Belgian and good looking .  On the palate evidently rich and powerful but a complexity that twists my palate from sweet ,toward tart fruit (cherry) then pears and dried almonds , and then morphs in conjunction with the richness of the opening to finish  in rich boozy complexity . Fuck the aroma .cause this is most good stuff if you do.
En riktig god belgare. Kraftig och stor i munnen, söt kryddad med doft av bränt söcker. Smak av karmell och torkad frukt med en lång rund eftersmak.

Bottle 330 ml [2011]. Appearance: Bottle is so ugly, but the beers pour a nice brown with reddish highlights. Nice head foam, rapidly diminishing. Aroma: Complex, malt, caramel and fruits. Taste: Complex with alcohol, caramel, fruits and a slightly bitter finish. Overall: Beer is complex with warming alcohol and is different from others of this kind.
Clear dark orangey amber with a lasting beige head. Aroma is sweet, malty, heavy caramel and dried fruit. Flavor is quite sweet and moderate bitter. Sweet finish. Smooth and very soft. 270212

Bière brune extra-forte de 9 % dalcool. Col mousseux et épais, elle possède un goût sucré. Elle possède un minime arrière-goût salé. On reconnait un fond de café et un léger goût de mélasse et de céréales, style sarrasin. Très bonne, rafraîchissante.

33cl bottle.
Brune trouble, col léger beige.
Arôme de fruits noirs, réglisse avec une pointe dester/levure, malt léger et une pointe dune épice/grain rappelant le millet. 
En bouche, profile malté mélangeant une approche fruitée noire allant vers la date, prune, raisin, figue, le tout sur une épice de réglisse, pointe de vanille. Profile grains, malt grillé/cara laissant se développer un mélange entre douceur-aigreur fruitée avec un côté sirop collant aux lèvres.

750 ml bottle from bsuedekum- thanks again, Blake! Pours a murky plum brown color with a small beige head. Aroma of caramel malts, plums, dates, candi sugar, sweet dough, and some nutty, leafy, earthy notes. Flavor of caramel malts, dried and dark fruits, candi sugar, tobacco leaves, fruitcake, and cola syrup. Medium-bodied, with a rich, chewy mouthfeel with some grittiness to it and moderate carbonation. Sweet and complex. Didnt quite meet my admittedly high expectations but excellent nonetheless.

Hazy dark brown red beer, with beige head. Little bit of a gusher, probably because I didnt have the patience to give it a rest after the ride home...Love the taste of this! Reminds me of the Westvleteren 8 and 12. Dark overripe fruit, raisins, some toffee, yeast, some earthiness.

From notes: Poured a hazy nut brown with some orange in it and a huge light tan head.  Sour fruit aroma, maybe cherry, mixed with yeast funk as well as some spice and citrus.  Deep, with a slight thickness to the palate.  Candied fruit flavor, with a touch of sourness.  Earthy yeast and a spice note in the finish.  As it warms, the sourness evens out a bit and a nutty malt characteristic appears.  Excellent.

Pours dark brown with ruby edges and a large creamy beige head. Aroma of doughy, fruity yeast, some nutty malt. Lots of molasses and dark fruit, some leather, viney hop, and tobacco. Taste is rich with earthy bitterness and lots of dark fruit and molasses sweetness, some soy and cola flavor, but not in a bad way. It finishes with lots of juicy sweetness and an ever so slight roasted taste. The aroma is really complex with a lot of plum, fig, date, tobacco aroma. This is one of those beers that changes nicely as it warms and each revisit to the aroma yields something new. Thick texture with rich, full, smooth carbonation. A really awesome beer.

Reddish brown colour, beige head. Aroma of malts, caramel, toffee, dried dark fruits, light milk chocolate. Flavour sweet malty, light caramel, slight raisins. Some bitterness coming through. Quite alcoholic, roasted malts finish.
(From 33cL bottle @ Poatersgat, Brugge)

UPDATED: NOV 15, 2012 aroma: caramel, floral, alcohol, 
apparenza: red, cloudy, frothy, 
gusto: heavy cloying sweetness, lightly bitter, 
palato: full body, slick feel, lively, long finish, 
sorprendente..si presenta con un bel rosso acceso e una bella schiuma compatta..al naso colpiscono tutti odori "dolci":molto fruttata,caramello,poco percepibile il classico pungente aroma luppolato..al gusto colpisce soprattutto per la sua dolcezza (leggermente eccessiva probabilmente), a causa delluso di 7 malti che la rendono così futtata ma con un qualcosa di diverso da una tripla o da una belgian strong ale,soprattutto nel retrogusto luppolato che si scopre solo nella fase degustativa e che fortunatamente bilancia la dolcezza sempre piacevole..in bocca perdura a lungo,avvolgendola come deve fare una birra del suo calibro.unica pecca,la dolcezza troppo elevata..

Pour is dark reddish slightly brown with slightly off white almost yellow head out of 375 mL bottle.  Aroma brings notes of caramel, lots of toffee, nice yeasty dark fruit, earth, hints of biscuit and bready malts, some hints of green and red raisin as well.  Taste is a mix of lots of green and red raisin, hints of vanilla, caramel, toffee notes, sweet fruit with some white grape and pear notes, touch of earth notes, more sweet sugars mix into a sweet finish.   The complexity opens up for sure as it warms up.

Bottle @ Dans house, courtesy of arminjewell. Thanks! Cloudy, brown appearance with a tan head. Rich candy sugar, mild anise, dark chocolate, Belgian yeasty, toasty malty aroma. Lively carbonation. Pretty rich, toffee, candy sugar, dark fruity, plum, raisin, caramel/chocolate flavor.
Lots of caramel, malt, candy sugar, and a little belgian yeast in the aroma.  Flavor is malty and sweet with a little roast and some citrus.  Carbonation and some alcohol in the finish.  Tremendous.
Beautiful beer. Up front raisins, dark fruit, some caramel. Taste is sweet. Creamy in the mouth with medium carbonation. Sweet finish lasts long int eh mouth. Pours a medium brown.

Bottle. Pour is deep brown/ruby with tons of floaties. Aroma of prune, raisin, belgo yeast, fig. Taste is quite sweet, prune/raisin flavor, caramel. Palate is slick, sweet, low carbonation, big sticky finish.

75cl bottle from Drink Monger. Pours a copper colour with a reddish tinge. Lovely aroma of raisins, alcohol, toffee, caramel and plums. Similar flavours with raisins and plums upfront, caramel, alcohol and toffee again. Lovely chewy mouth-feel with lingering dry fruits and alcohol. Mild carbonation. Lovely.
coffee, citrus, basement aromas, cough drop, smoke, black, brown foam, medium sweetness, medium bitterness, full body, creamy, average carbonation,

330 ml bottle. Deep oak brown with a rich tan head. Get a real whoosh of bananas, plum and figs from the bubbles on top. once they fade, its tougher to get the nose, but theres subtle fruits and malts. On the tongue is very smooth and balanced. Theres a lot of natural carbonation and very little alcohol burn (though you CAN sense its there). Cooked fruit tastes, pears, theres some burnt woods, candies. Sweet on the tongue with a little bitter. Very complex and each mouthful seems to impart something new. Raisins. This is cracking. My brain is almost imploding from having to figure out exactly whats going on here... but theres certainly nothing unpleasant... its all good, pleasant and enjoyable.

Bottle from Jason - thanks!  Murky brown pour with yeast chunks and a nice tan head.  Aroma is dried fruit, smoke, caramel, and a bit of sweetness.  Taste is smooth with plum, light alcohol, roasted malt, and a bit of darker fruit.  Even mouth feel.  Very enjoyable and Id like to try a fresher bottle for purposes of comparison.

Una cerveza que descubrí no hace mucho en un pequeño local. Tiene todos los elementos que para mi deben caracterizar a una gran cerveza. Un sabor intenso, acompañado de un embriagador aroma y de alta graduacion.

Bière brune aux reflets roux. De belles odeurs dagrumes; dorange, de pétales de rose, dun soupçon daneth et dherbe. Goût sucré/surette, de raisin vert avec des trace dalcool, malgré son pourcentage élevé, ça passe très bien. 
(118-251111)

UPDATED: DEC 28, 2011 Very dark red colour. Light brown head.
Smells very malty, hint of spices, very small hint of some roasted malts.
Taste is sweet, malty, Dark fruits. Very rich and full.

Quite boozy but a very good beer nonetheless. Try it if you can.

Bottle at the congress, longton. Dark brown, small bubbles a la rochefort. Plum, alcohol which is not overpowering. This is bloody marvellous. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

I opened this straight from the fridge, which was a big mistake as the aroma was almost non-existing. Left it for half an hour and it was a completely different beer. Great aroma and taste of caramel malts, dark dried fruits, some smoked flavors and belgian yeast. Nice bitterness to balance the sweetness of the beer. I liked it a lot!

Bottle served in a tulip. Dark amber brown with a short head. Aroma is spicy, malty, sweet, fruity, musty, woody, with a backdrop of yeast. Bright and complex. Rich, fruity, sweet flavor. Delicious. Full-medium body, thick creamy texture, decent carbonation, and a long, malty finish. The commercial description is spot on. This is a big, brown, belgian beast!
Toffee, cookie, lots of spices. It doesnt look pretty good. Good but nothing spectacular.

75cl bottle. Smoked amber/dark red and hazy with a big head that goes off in a blink. Nose : Deep smoked, caramel and toffee notes. Cherry esters. Dried fruits. Yeast smell more like leather. Sip : Creamy with a strong carbonation that is alive even when swallowed. Sweet with aromas of dried fruits like plums and apples. Smoky feeling still there. Spices like cinnamon and a little bit of clove. This thing becomes a bit bitter and its a mix of bitter roasted malts and bitter hops. Nice balance.

Flaske 0,33l på Heeren van Liedekercke i Denderleew 1 Mai 2011. Dyp brun / svart. Høyt kremaktig skum. Fin maltaroma. Godt balansert smak. Litt malt. Litt frukt. Behagelig fruktig & maltig ettersmak som varer.

Refrigerated bottle poured into a trappist glass.  Pour dark brown with big chunks of yeast and small crimson highlights.  Thick small bubble lacing, medium body, and highly carbonated (pour into glass quickly mine was a gusher).  Taste is dark fruit, honey, and some molasses.  Good brown belgian ale, but I prefer others.
Pours brown with a dense 1/4" head and tons of sediment. Good aroma of malt, yeast and a little hops. Smooth, medium body with a lot of malt and molasses flavors.

Part of a mixpack from systembolagets beställningssortiment. Nice and complex beer. Surprisingly drinkable for an all malt belgian of that strength. Lots of caramel tones and belgian yeast, with just enough hops to break the sweetness with out taking over the maltiness.

NOSE: sour candy, cheese (swiss?), malt sugars, eucalyptus(?), caramel-ish; APPEARANCE: dark brown, translucent - lots of malt and yeast particulate, adequate head and lacing; TASTE: slightly sour, sweet, strongly malty; PALATE: big body, slightly sticky, quick finish; OVERALL Big taste

330ml bottle. Hazy and sediment brown with a huge and billowy biege head that gradually fades to a nice layer, more tan then biege. Yeast, caramelized brown sugar, vinous notes, good malt backbone with some plum and berries, bit of vanilla. Sweet, full bodied, average carbonation, booze and a bit prickly, dries out but remain sweet with a nice malt and fruit finish. Very tasty.
Floral hops, a touch of musk.  Full, rich taste - an excellent beer.  A touch of sweetness, but not too much for my tasting...

33cl bottle. Brown with tan head, good lasting and lacing. Aroma is to caramel, brown sugar, dark fruits, nuts. Flavour is very sweet, spicy, candy sugar and caramel, with an alcoholic aftertaste with good persistence and long. The final is slightly bittery. Well balanced. Body is medium to full. Carbonation is medium to high.
Aroma of oak. Nice balance between bitterness and sweetness. Outstanding overall.

Bottle at a pub in Ghent. It poured a dark hazy amber liquid with a light beige head. Fruity smell with red berries, fairly malty vineous. Similar taste, malt and sweet. Fairly smooth mouthfeel. A very nice and complex beer.

Bottle from SAQ. Dark brown with orange notes and a thick beige head with everlasting retention, really one of the best head retention I have ever seen! Aroma is brown sugar, alcohol, dark fruits, toasted malt, dark honey, warm alcohol and yeast. Flavor is fruity and sweet with nice toasted belgian malt, brown sugar, figs, plums, dark honey, alcohol, yeast and some floral notes. A great strong belgian ale!

Abbaye des Rocs! Lots of sediment to be swirled about or left in the bottle. I generally like fine sediment in my glass. This is a nice, thick beer of a rather high standard. When Im in the mood, few beers can give me greater enjoyment than this one. Malty, but not too sweet, I cant find a flaw.

750ml bottle in a Trappist glass.  Pours rubyish/brown with a lacy, beige head.  Aroma of spicy yeast, caramel and nutty malts, and some light floral hops.  Flavor about the same, with a lot of sweet maltiness.  Smoother texture.  A good Belgian beer, but the bottle might be a little old.

33cl bottle, tulip glass (Duvel). Pours dark brown, with a lot of foam, I had to wait some secs to pour the last third of the bottle. That hughe heads dissapears quickly, and there some yeast floaties. Malted and fruity aroma, very subtle. Taste of caramel, coffe, plums and licorice at the end. Big body, easy to drink, but I remember a stronger flavour the last time I drank it. Reminds me of Rochefort 8 in some ways

750ml bottle (filtered). Sweet dark fruit aromas. Pours brown with a white head.  Flavors of root beer, plum and sugary sweet malts. Overall a very good brune but was WAY better before they started filtering.

Bottle, thanks to Fred82 for this one. Pours murky brown with a reddish flash; MASSIVE pale tan head, which is remarkably persistent, starts 3 fingers thick and slowly works its way down from there. Nose is clean cardboard, some dark fruit lightly soapy, frankly smells a bit.... sterile. Flavours of spicy prunes, leather, pipe tobacco, brandied fruit, wonderful tartness, quite fruitcake-like, a wonderful tasting beer. An odd experience all around though, smells like very little, taste is almost peerless. Odd.

Well down to the last third of this giant ass bottle. Got a murky brown brew here after the initial explosion, plenty of light brown bubbly cap. Wonderful, fruity and tempting aroma. Sweet and airy, plums, liquid brown sugar, red apples, plums and raisins, light yeast and a bit of old. Very nice - not spectacular but exactly what I needed. Addicting flavours kept me from reviewing until this point. Initial light yeast spice that holds half the way through but near the bottom it really hangs around. Brown sugar, raisin, plum, spice, maybe a hint of anise, light earth, wonderful sweetness that is perfectly balanced with slightly sour here and there, dark malts, goodness! Medium bodied, never noticed the 9%, very smooth, I think the after taste has been short lived because I havent stopped drinking the big ass bottle. Really a flawless bottle of amazingly easy drinking stuff - a treat for sure.

UPDATED: AUG 5, 2012 33 cl bottle @ home, BBE 20.02.2012
Aroma has lots of ripe fruits and some sweet toffee typical to aged belgian ales. Also some hints of candi and brown sugar. Flavour is slightly sourish with ripe fruits, some toffee, raisins and spices. Becomes syrupy after some sips. Warming alcohol feeling at the end. Brilliant belgian ale!

Gets rather strong on toffee and orange when aging (BBE 2010 on 2012). I like this one best just before the BBE date.

bottle in Maudite snifter. cloudy burgundy colour with a huge beige head. aroma is funky, dark fruitd and Belgian yeast. taste is dominated by sweet notes of plum and raisins. very sweet. medium bodied, alcohol well hidden. i was very excited for this one, feel a little let down.

Sampled @ SBWF on September 29. Pours reddish brown with a white head. Smell is sweet with peaches and plums in it. Taste is huge with tons going on. Its sweet and theres lots of fresh fruits and some subtle notes of dried fruit. It has a slight bitterness that suits the beer very well. Great taste!

11.09.09 bottle from saq A: dark small fruits, chocolate, dark caramel, spiciness. App: brown white lasting head T/P: body is full its fizzy initially sweet then it finishes with a pleasant bitterness. You do get a bit of warming from the alcohol. O: excellent love the malt structure on that one it has a nice depth. Finally watch your pour its really carbed.

Cloudy dark orange body with light beige foamy head. Aroma of plums, dates, licorice, caramel and toffee. Also some cedar smells impression. Rotting corpse. Ginger and cherry tornado on tastebuds. Sweet mouthfeel full of brown sugar and spices. Overwhelming. Alcohol % is well hidden by the complex but charming taste. A very good one!
Bottle in tulip glass. Chocolate and malt aroma. Dark reddish brown colour. Taste is dried fruit, caramel, chocolate.

Deep burgundy pour with a thin off white head and light lacing .... aroma is of fruity yeasty and roasted/sweet caramel malts ..... taste is smooth and malty with roasted and caramel malts with a nice yeasty fruitiness and some subtle spicy and bitter touch of hops .... very soft and smooth mouthfeel amazing combination of flavors abv hidden well

33 cl bottle. BBE 20.02.2012.
Originally rated on 20100402.
Pours cloudy dark orange colour, medium thick head. Lots of sediment even though poured only half of the bottle into the glass. Very complex aroma of ripe fruits, plum, raisins, distinct aged belgian yeastiness. sweet malts and caramel, notes of toffee and licorice at the end. Flavour of sour and ripe fruits, raisins, plum, dark malts, caramel and toffee. Very complex, balanced and exciting brew worth storing in your cellar.
5336

Dark brown with a reddish tint, moderate beige head, and tons of yeast chunks floating around. Aroma of caramel, figs, spice, wood, and mild yeast. Taste is moderately sweet, malty and slightly bitter. Slightly dry, full bodied, a bit thick and creamy. Good stuff.
Balancé, ronde avec une bonne corpulence. Caramel et figues aussitôt dissipés en fin de bouche. Pas particulièrement complexe, très facile à boire.
