Bottled, 2001 bottling?  Gorgeous dark-amber/orange color with a huge head; wonderful nose (I cant add much to what others have said; loads going on, with a huge malt/yeast texture).  Guslers description overall is probably about the best; very sweet, with dominant caramel, apples and pears, and perhaps a hint of brandy.  Wonderful body, great finish.  Even though I had a weak cork and some of it ended up in the brew, this is one of the five best beers Ive ever had and my clear new favorite among the Belgians.  Like Trap, I got it for 4.99; unbelievable!

WOW!, If there is a better sniffing beer than this, please let me know. Pours a deep cloudy brown, large frothy beige head and sheets of lace. Nose is a ripe banana, sweet cherries, with a touch of grainy malt. Start is sweet, middle thin, the finish is acidic, moderate carbonation and a touch of dryness, and a pleasent hop and alcohol bitterness to top off this most MAGNIFICENT BEER

UPDATED: OCT 6, 2007 750 ml:  One of the most complete and complex aromas a beer can have;  peaches, green apples, subtle caramel, honey dew, melon and pineapple.  The taste is very rounded with caramel giving a hand with some (sour) raisins?, banana, and a slew of other beautiful flavors.  Sweet and sour.  Mouthfeel is very soft and silky.  I found this for just $4.99, unbelievable!!  Midas touch, etc. were being sold for $10 a pop.  get real, this is one of the worlds finest beers.  If they would just rid the green bottle it would have been in better condition.  It seems to sit on the shelf for such a long time going unnoticed.  I know where I am going next week with my pay check.
user_location: Blue Ridge Mountains, North Carolina, USA

text: This is a outstanding ale! Probably some of the best Belgian Ale that I have had in a long time!

Losts of flavour but nothing too overpowering, blackcurrant, hop resins and alcohol last all the way to the bottom of the bottle, head doesnt last long but the beer is none the worse for it. I would give it a higher score but I know there are even better beers out there.

Brass-brown medium-intense, some matter floating around and not fully limpid, quickly fading white foam and little bubbles.  After the foam has gone, a beautiful radiant hue remains.
Vinous and very special aroma, followed by good hops, with depth.  At room temperature, this beer actually develops complexity in the aroma, very good.
Very fine tasty flavor, some licorice, bread-yeast with a medium-hoppy dry finish.  Good foamy body in the mouth.
Well balanced sweetness-alcohol-hops, long aftertaste.
A very interesting beer, not unlike the medium-bodied versions of some trappist beers (8) but with perhaps a bit more hops than most (except Orval).
Very few head, pleasant pale brown colour. Aroma: hazelnut, very thick. Long aftertaste.

Its obvious there is significant variation from bottle to bottle with this beer. Bovs headless beer was a gorgeous masterpiece in my glass for the duration of the session. Very deep malty aromas with only some fruit of the prune variety, molasses and the spicy air of brandy. The strength of the beer revealed itself with a tingle or burn to the lips and mucous membranes. The finish was sharp and herbal -- also quite different than what others describe. Still a remarkable beer! Thank you Shadallion!
It started off strong but ended with a metallic taste that turned me off.

This is why I drink. Very close to my favorite. If it were not for the occasional slight corkiness from its arduous journey to me; I think it may be perfection. Rich, smooth and somewhat delicate. And what a bouquet.

This is one of the very few beers that I give a perfect score. It seems like no one else knows about this beer, but let me tell you, its a beauty. Burgundy color, ripe fruit aroma, amazing sweet-sour contrasting taste. As good as it gets.
red-brown colour, no foam; aroma: ginger bread, plum, chocolate; flavor: ginger bread, intense; aftertaste: very sweet, long

UPDATED: MAR 24, 2003 Light brown, with a rich head.  One of the best aromas in beer - plum, fruity hops, alcohol, mandarin orange, light cocoa.  Alcohol, sweet palt malts, orange, mango, pear, peach - sweet, fruity, long flavours.
